dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Somalian man hunches over a body wrapped in a sheet and covers the dead man's face.

dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: The images of a lonely truck driving through ravaged countryside, bodies everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: BIBLICAL SCALE.
dialogues.text: We now see that the truck is from the Red Cross as _it mo through the ruins of a bombed and burned village. Past bo some dead, some alive. No sound but the wind. Nothing els moves across scorched earth. SUPER: 300,000 CIVILIANS DIE OF STARVATION.

dialogues.speaker: WARLORDS, RULES THE CAPITAL MOGADISHU.
dialogues.text: A body wrapped in a sheet is carried away.

dialogues.speaker: MARINES, FOOD IS DELIVERED AND ORDER IS RESTORED.
dialogues.text: A U.N. Peacekeeper helps a wearied man drink.

dialogues.speaker: DECLARES WAR ON THE U.N. PEACEKEEPERS.
dialogues.text: The Peacekeeper walks past the bodies of dead children.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIERS, AND BEGIN TARGETING AMERICAN PERSONNEL.
dialogues.text: Lifeless refugees are drawn to the aid station.

dialogues.speaker: AIDID AND RESTORE ORDER.
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking out at the smoldering, wind-whipped village from inside a bomb-ravaged house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first rays of sunshine hit us -- and a BLACK HAWK HELICOPTER thunders over the arid Somali landscape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A handsome Ranger, SERGEANT MATT EVERSMANN, surveys the village below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A make-shift camp surrounding a bombed-out building on a hilltop bustles with energy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several "Technicals", old Toyota trucks with heavy machin gun bolted in back, ROAR through the village. Starving residents swarm a five-ton Red Cross transport t loaded with food as the Black Hawk floats slowly past. The scene turns chaotic: villagers shake the truck; Somal soldiers beat them back with sticks; ten-pound sacks of w spill onto the ground; hordes of stick-thin villagers str to grab the sacks. A Somali GUNMAN OPENS FIRE on the mob. Blood splatters as few get hit. Screams. Panic. People scatter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MATT EVERSMANN jolts from the sight of the bloodbath. Whi inside to the other RANGERS in the Black Hawk's belly.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Oh shit, did you see that? (into headset) Chief, we got unarmed civilians getting shot down here at nine o'clock! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Durant surveys the scene below, then calmly speaks into h headset.

dialogues.speaker: DURANT
dialogues.text: I got it Matt, I don't think we can touch this. Heavily armed Militiamen train weapons on the populace. O shouts into a megaphone:

dialogues.speaker: MILITIA MAN
dialogues.text: (in Somali, subtitled) This food is the roperty of Mohammed Farrah Aidid! Go back to your homes! Durant's Black Hawk circles the village.

dialogues.speaker: DURANT
dialogues.text: Command, Super Six Four we got militia shooting unarmed civilians down at the food distribution center. Request permission to engage.

dialogues.speaker: MATTHEWS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Super Six Four, are you taking fire, over? Somali Militia men flee into the crowd as Delta sniper SG DAN BUSCH trains his AR-15 rifle on the gunmen below.

dialogues.speaker: DURANT
dialogues.text: Negative, Command.

dialogues.speaker: MATTHEWS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: U.N.'sS jurisdiction, Six Four. We can't intervene. Return to base. Over.

dialogues.speaker: DURANT
dialogues.text: (frustrated) Roger. Six Four returning. Durant continues the chopper away from the village. ON _EVERSMANN - staring down at the carnage-strewn street below. He can't believe it. BELOW - The militia man aims his megaphone at the Black H as though he's firing a gun at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The market bustles with activity. Militia men stroll the streets, automatic rifles strapped across their backs. HOOT slinks through the crowd, following a Somali DRIVER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OSMAN ATTO, a wealthy Somali businessman, reads a USA Tod as he eats. The driver approaches.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: (subtitled) Ready, Mr. Atto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver leads Atto to the waiting car. Hoot watches, s into a microphone in his collar.

dialogues.speaker: HOOT
dialogues.text: Leaving. Atto gets in his car and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Atto's caravan speeds through the dusty streets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several Black Hawk Helicopters track the caravan out of t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Atto smokes a cigar in the back seat, talks on his cell p A Black Hawk Helicopter appears out the truck's window, f beside them.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: (subtitled) Sir! Atto looks out the window at the Black Hawk.

dialogues.speaker: ATTO
dialogues.text: (subtitled) Keep driving. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A Ranger fires at_the hood of Atto's car, spraying oil al over the windshield. An MH-6 Little Bird, a transport chopper with two outside benches, lands in front of the caravan, forcing them to s Rangers surround Atto's vehicle and tap on the glass.

dialogues.speaker: ATTO
dialogues.text: (calmly into phone, subtitled) I'm going to be late. Call you back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. The room is dark, except for the dusty yellow st cast from the window. Atto sits at a.table as GENERAL GARRISON enters and sets cup opposite him. Garrison wears khaki shorts and_T-shirt and dons sunglasses in the poorly lit room. He's laconic. eady. Atto offers Garrison a cigar.

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: No, no thanks. I've got one.

dialogues.speaker: ATTO
dialogues.text: These are Cuban. Bolivar. Bellicoso. Garrison holds up his own cigar.

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: (unimpressed, simply) So's this.

dialogues.speaker: ATTO
dialogues.text: (laughs) Miami, my friend, is not Cuba... Garrison simply stares out the window. Atto lights his ci regards it for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: ATTO
dialogues.text: I see not catching Aidid is becoming a routine.

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: We weren't trying to catch Aidid, we were trying to catch you.

dialogues.speaker: ATTO
dialogues.text: Me? (laughs) But am I that important? I hardly think so. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: You're just a business man.

dialogues.speaker: ATTO
dialogues.text: Trying to make a living. Garrison finally takes a seat opposite Atto.

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: Selling guns to Aidid's militia.

dialogues.speaker: ATTO
dialogues.text: (a beat, gravely) You've been here what, six weeks? Six weeks you are trying to catch the General. You put up your wanted posters. $25,000... what is this, gunfight at the K.O. corral?

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: (laughs) It's ah, it's the 0.K. Corral.

dialogues.speaker: ATTO
dialogues.text: Do you think bringing me in will make him suddenly come to you? Make him more agreeable? Hmm?

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: (simply) You know where he sleeps. You pay for his beds, much less his militia. (the bottom line) We're not leaving Somalia until we find him. And we will find him.

dialogues.speaker: ATTO
dialogues.text: (immediately) Don't make the mistake of thinking because I grew up without running water I'm simple, General. I do know something about history. See all this? It's simply shaping tomorrow -- a tomorrow without a lot of Arkansas white-boy's ideas in it.

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: Well, I wouldn't know about that, I'm from Texas. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ATTO
dialogues.text: Mr. Garrison, I think you shouldn't have come here. This is civil war. This is our war, not yours.

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: (finally rips off his sunglasses) 300,000 dead and counting; That's_ not a war, Mr. Atto, that's genocide. Now you enjoy that tea, you hear? Garrison exits swiftly past two U.S. Marine guards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garrison strides through the hangar, past helicopters.

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: How'd he strike you? JOE CRIBBS, a tall, lean man a few years younger than Garrison, falls into step beside the General.

dialogues.speaker: CRIBBS
dialogues.text: Urbane, sophisticated. Cruel.

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: Yeah, he's a good catch. (they stop) It'll take some time, but Aidid'1l feel the loss.

dialogues.speaker: CRIBBS
dialogues.text: I'm not sure time is something we've got in great supply.

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: This isn't Iraq, you know. It's more complicated than that. Garrison starts away. Cribbs trails him.

dialogues.speaker: CRIBBS
dialogues.text: Boss, most of Washington might disagree. I'm just saying, they've been calling for these dang situation reports every morning this week.

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: (slips the sunglasses back on) Well, tell 'em the situation is ah, fragile. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: And with that Garrison exits a door into BLINDING SUNLIGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black Hawk pilot CLIFF "ELVIS" WOLCOTT addresses his Rang passengers as he prepares for take-off.

dialogues.speaker: WOLCOTT
dialogues.text: Well ladies and gentlemen, my name is Cliff "Elvis" Wolcott. I'll be your pilot this afternoon. Federal regulations has designated this is a non-smoking Black Hawk helicopter. For those of you enrolled in our Mogadishu frequent flyer program, you'll be earning a hundred free credits this afternoon, and as always, the air sickness bags are located in the seat back in front of you.

dialogues.speaker: BRILEY
dialogues.text: Number one indications are good, Cliff.

dialogues.speaker: ELVIS
dialogues.text: You got it.

dialogues.speaker: BRILEY
dialogues.text: Clear on two.

dialogues.speaker: RANGER
dialogues.text: And you're still clear at one. The Black Hawk takes off into the blaring sun.

dialogues.speaker: BETWEEN BLACK HAWK SUPER SIX ONE AND DURANT'S BL
dialogues.text: HAWK as they skirt the coastline.

dialogues.speaker: DURANT
dialogues.text: Six One, this is Six Four. Go to UHF secure. I've got some bad news.

dialogues.speaker: WOLCOTT
dialogues.text: Limo's a word Durant, I don't want to hear about it.

dialogues.speaker: DURANT
dialogues.text: It is not a word, it's an abbreviation of a word. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WOLCOTT
dialogues.text: Limo is a word in common usage. That is the key phrase in Scrabble, my good friend. Common usage.

dialogues.speaker: DURANT
dialogues.text: No! If it is not in the dictionary, it doesn't count.

dialogues.speaker: WOLCOTT
dialogues.text: It doesn't have to be in the dictionary!

dialogues.speaker: DURANT
dialogues.text: It does have to be in the dictionary!

dialogues.speaker: WOLCOTT
dialogues.text: They don't say limousine, they say limo!

dialogues.speaker: DURANT
dialogues.text: Listen, when we get back to the base, it's coming off the board. Durant and Elvis rubber-neck as they pass each other, fly opposite directions.

dialogues.speaker: WOLCOTT
dialogues.text: You touch my limo and I'1l spank you, night stalker, you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: DURANT
dialogues.text: Yeah, promises.

dialogues.speaker: OTHIC
dialogues.text: That's a nice beach down there. How's the water?

dialogues.speaker: DURANT
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's nice and warm. It's loaded with sharks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clean slap of computer keys. A cigarette smolders. Ra clerk SGT. JOHN GRIMES types data into a computer. Standi opposite his desk is PFC TODD BLACKBURN.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMES
dialogues.text: Name?

dialogues.speaker: BLACKBURN
dialogues.text: Todd. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GRIMES
dialogues.text: Last name?

dialogues.speaker: BLACKBURN
dialogues.text: Blackburn.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMES
dialogues.text: (Grimes enters the info) First name Todd.

dialogues.speaker: BLACKBURN
dialogues.text: So what's it like?

dialogues.speaker: GRIMES
dialogues.text: (without looking up) What's what like?

dialogues.speaker: BLACKBURN
dialogues.text: Mogadishu. The fighting.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMES
dialogues.text: Serial number?

dialogues.speaker: GRIMES
dialogues.text: (enters the info, then) irstly, it's "The MOG, or simply: "Mog." flo one calls itâ€™ Mogadishu here, Secondly, I wouldn't know about the fighting, so don't ask.

dialogues.speaker: BLACKBURN
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: GRIMES
dialogues.text: Didn't I just say "don't ask"? (takes a drag off cigarette) Look kid, you look like you're about twelve, so let me explain something to you. I have a rare and mysterious skill that precludes me from going on missions.

dialogues.speaker: BLACKBURN
dialogues.text: Typing?

dialogues.speaker: GRIMES
dialogues.text: (pauses typing) Can you type?

dialogues.speaker: BLACKBURN
dialogues.text: No. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GRIMES
dialogues.text: (immediately resumes typing) Date of birth?
Like chiseling into a headstone, Grimes types into the "a field - 18. Hands young Blackburn his I.D.

dialogues.speaker: BLACKBURN
dialogues.text: (affirmatively) Well I'm here to kick some ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoot smokes a cigar on top of a sand dune as a Black Hawk passes over him. We see that he is holding his mountain b Wolcott lands the Black Hawk Super Six One on the beach, kicks up a storm of sand. Hoot shoulders his bike, hustle into the chopper.

dialogues.speaker: HOOT
dialogues.text: (over the ROAR of the chopper blades) Nice man, very smooth!

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: (impressed with himself) Single shot through the engine block!

dialogues.speaker: HOOT
dialogues.text: Shit, that's a shame man. That's a nice jeep. The Black Hawk lifts off and kicks up a cloud of sand as flies away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A line of Rangers fire M-16s at targets. A military "Hummer" drives up to the range. Behind the firing line, Eversmann blows a WHISTLE. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Cease fire, cease fire! (the shooting stops) Check your weapons. Grimes and Blackburn approach from the Hummer.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMES
dialogues.text: Sergeant Eversmann! (as Eversmann turns) Sarge.

dialogues.speaker: BLACKBURN
dialogues.text: Private First Class Blackburn.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: (blankly) Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: BLACKBURN
dialogues.text: Reporting for duty.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Not to me you're not. You're reporting to Lieutenant Beales. He should be around here somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMES
dialogues.text: Can I leave him with you? Grimes just wants to leave. He's got things to do. Eversm smirks -- go head, go.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Yeah, go ahead. (to Blackburn) You brought your weapon?

dialogues.speaker: BLACKBURN
dialogues.text: Sergeant. Want me to shoot? I'm rested.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: When'd you get in?

dialogues.speaker: BLACKBURN
dialogues.text: Just now, Sergeant. Blackburn looks so young and eager, and already sunburned down one side of his face from the chopper ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A herd of wild boars flees from the chopper.  13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upon sight of the boars Hoot cocks his rifle.

dialogues.speaker: HOOT
dialogues.text: Hey, who's hungry? The other Rangers smirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoot stands before a wild boar on a rotating BBQ spit. Me move along the chow line. CAPTAIN STEELE, Ranger ground commander, steps up behind Delta Sergeant SANDERSON in line.

dialogues.speaker: STEELE
dialogues.text: What is this, Sanderson? Another taxpayer funded Delta safari?

dialogues.speaker: SANDERSON
dialogues.text: Not if General Garrison's asking.

dialogues.speaker: STEELE
dialogues.text: No, I'm asking.

dialogues.speaker: SANDERSON
dialogues.text: Have a nice meal, Captain. IN THE LINE -- Hoot cuts in front of Blackburn, grabs foo

dialogues.text: Hey man, there's a line.

dialogues.speaker: HOOT
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: BLACKBURN
dialogues.text: Well, this isn't the back of it.

dialogues.speaker: HOOT
dialogues.text: Man, I know.

dialogues.speaker: STEELE
dialogues.text: Sergeant, Sergeant? Hoot turns to see Steel staring at him.

dialogues.speaker: STEELE
dialogues.text: What's going on here? Sanderson watches them from down the chow line. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HOOT
dialogues.text: Oh, just some aerial target practice sir, didn't want to leave it behind.

dialogues.speaker: STEELE
dialogues.text: I'm talking about your weapon. Delta or no Delta, that's a hot weapon. You know better than that. You're patety should be on at all times on ase.

dialogues.speaker: HOOT
dialogues.text: (shows Steele his finger) Well this is my safety, sir. Hoot walks off with his plate of food. Sanderson stops St from going after Hoot.

dialogues.speaker: SANDERSON
dialogues.text: Let it go sir, the guy hasn't eaten in a couple of days.

dialogues.speaker: STEELE
dialogues.text: You Dboys are a bunch of undisciplined cowboys. Let me tell you something, soldier. When we get on the five yard line you re onna need my Rangers. Ya'll better Learn to be team players. It's rough out ere. Sanderson walks away as LT. COLONEL MCKNIGHT watches from his table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The barracks is divided by the arrangement of the cots. Rangers here, Delta there, relaxing over Risk, Stratego, cribbage, cards, Gameboys. Ping-pong games in the corner. Pilots Durant and Wolcott are continuing their Scrabble g PILLA stands before a group of young men as though he's o stage. He imitates Captain Steele, much to the amusement the men. Pilla tries to hide his thick "Joyzee" accent:

dialogues.speaker: PILLA
dialogues.text: Speak up! (touches his forehead) You say this is your safety? Well this is my boot Son, and it will fit up your ass with the proper amount of force. Off to the side Eversmann writes a letter. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RANGER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Is that a Jersey accent?

dialogues.speaker: RANGER 2, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It's Georgia.

dialogues.speaker: PILLA
dialogues.text: (to another Ranger) You'se guys, I'm trying to do this. Give me a break. (back in character) Take those sunglasses off, Soldier. Delta wants to wear Oakleys, that's their business, I don't want to see them on you again, hooah? Other Rangers laughingly mock his "hooah."

dialogues.speaker: PILLA
dialogues.text: Hey, is that a hot weapon? DELTA SECTION - Gordon plops in a seat opposite Shughart Shughart studies a critical move, finger on his bishop.

dialogues.text: Is that your move?

dialogues.speaker: SHUGHART
dialogues.text: My hand on the piece?

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: I mate you in three whatever you do.

dialogues.speaker: SHUGHART
dialogues.text: I'd keep my eye on that queen before counseling with others.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: Well she's just lying in wait. NEARBY - WEX, the oldest Delta at 42, sketches on a pad. Busch leans over to see: a medieval knight dragging an enormous sword through a dense forest. Beautiful and scar

dialogues.speaker: BUSCH
dialogues.text: Wex. It's good. You're improving.

dialogues.speaker: WEX
dialogues.text: (Wex shrugs, it's okay) Ah.

dialogues.speaker: BUSCH
dialogues.text: If I may make a suggestion, observation? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WEX
dialogues.text: Mmm hmm?

dialogues.speaker: BUSCH
dialogues.text: It's a children's book, right?

dialogues.speaker: WEX
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: BUSCH
dialogues.text: They are not supposed to scare the living shit out of children.

dialogues.speaker: WEX
dialogues.text: This is the part of the story where our knight, our warrior is about to slay the one-eyed dragon and that's scary. Besides, my daughter loves this stuff.

dialogues.speaker: BUSCH
dialogues.text: I thought you finished that last week. Hmm?

dialogues.speaker: WEX
dialogues.text: You done? I had to get a visual. Across the hangar, Pilla is still doing his impression of Steele for the group.

dialogues.speaker: PILLA
dialogues.text: Hey, we are at the ten yard line here men, you understand? Can you count? One, two, ten. Okay? Where are my running backs? Where are my running backs? The Rangers laugh and respond with emphatic "hooahs". Pil doesn't notice as Steele enters.

dialogues.speaker: PILLA
dialogues.text: Hey, I didn't see you in church on Sunday soldier. Had something more important to do? Not on Sunday you don't. Not anymore. I will make you believe. You understand? Pilla turns and finds himself face-to-face with Steele himself. Goes ashen. Other Rangers watch to see what happ next. Steele, surprisingly, smiles good-naturedly.

dialogues.speaker: STEELE
dialogues.text: That's pretty funny, hooah? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Rangers respond with a slight "hooah".

dialogues.speaker: STEELE
dialogues.text: See, it's a good impression. I recognize myself. All right, carry on. Even though Steele seems to be taking it well, Pilla isn' able to relax.

dialogues.speaker: STEELE
dialogues.text: A quick word, specials. Pilla turns around and Steele grabs him in a headlock. Th Rangers laugh. Pilla flips the Rangers off behind his bac

dialogues.speaker: PILLA
dialogues.text: Yes, Sir?

dialogues.speaker: STEELE
dialogues.text: If I_ever see you undermine me again, you'll be cleaning latrines with your tongue until you can't taste he difference between shit and french fries. Is that clear?

dialogues.speaker: PILLA
dialogues.text: Hooah, sir.

dialogues.speaker: STEELE
dialogues.text: All right. The Rangers applaud Pilla as he returns and plops on a co between two guys. ANOTHER CORNER - KURTH, WADDELL, NELSON, and GOODALE talk around Eversmann, who busies himself with his letter. LT. BEALES is reading a book on Somalia.

dialogues.speaker: LT. BEALES
dialogues.text: Listen to this, if one skinny kills another skinny, his clan owes the dead guy's clan a hundred camels. A hundred camels. Waddell looks up from his book.

dialogues.speaker: WADDELL
dialogues.text: Camels. I wouldn't pay one camel.

dialogues.speaker: GOODALE
dialogues.text: Must be a lot of fucking camel debt. (carves on a piece of wood) Is that really true lieutenant? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Eversmann 18.

dialogues.speaker: LT. BEALES
dialogues.text: Ask Sergeant Eversmann. He likes the skinnies. finally looks up.

dialogues.speaker: GOODALE
dialogues.text: Eversmann, you really like the skinnies?

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: It's not that I like them or I don't like them. I respect them. Kurth leans back in his chair and deals the cards. They wait interest. Kurth star

dialogues.speaker: ON SCREEN
dialogues.text: cover int

dialogues.speaker: KURTH
dialogues.text: See, what you guys fail to realize is, Sergeant here is a bit of an idealist. Believes in this mission down to his very bones. Don't you, Sergeant?

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Look these people, they have no jobs, no food, no education, no future. I just figure that, you know, I mean, we either, we have two things we can do, we can either help, or we can sit back and watch the country destroy itself on CNN. Right?

dialogues.speaker: KURTH
dialogues.text: I don't know about you guys, but I was trained to fight. Were you trained to fight, Sergeant? for an answer. Lt. Beales watches him with bemused Eversmann chooses his words carefully.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Well, I think I was trained to make a difference, Kurth. ts laughing.

dialogues.speaker: LT. BEALES
dialogues.text: Like the man said, he's an idealist. (he looks at the TV) Oh wait, this is my favorite part. - A sniper fires at Steve Martin, who ducks for he gas station. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Everyone cracks up, but no one as_hard as Beales. Beales literally falling off his chair. It takes a moment for th others to realize he isn't laughing; he's choking on his tongue, having a seizure. A Ranger hurries to his side, waves the others back.

dialogues.speaker: RANGER
dialogues.text: No-no-no! Stay back, stay back! Eversmann stands, moves closer for a better look. The Ran cradles Beales.

dialogues.speaker: RANGER
dialogues.text: John, John, it's okay. John, John, John, it's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A speaker high atop a mosque calls out a morning prayer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A young Somali wearing a baseball cap backwards is on his knees, praying on the deserted beach in front of the old city. Then shoulders his rifle and gathers his things to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eversmann waits outside the tent as Steele approaches.

dialogues.speaker: STEELE
dialogues.text: Well, he'll be fine, but not in this army He's out of the game. He's epileptic, going home. (walks past Eversmann, turns back) I'm putting you in charge of his chalk. (off Eversmann's reaction) You got a problem with that?

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: No, sir.

dialogues.speaker: STEELE
dialogues.text: Now it's a big responsibility. Your men are going to look to you to make the right decisions. Their lives depend on it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: That's great. That makes Eversmann feel more anxious abou it.

dialogues.speaker: STEELE
dialogues.text: All right.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Rangers are the way, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: STEELE
dialogues.text: All the way. Good luck, son. Steele walks away. Eversmann turns back to the Infirmary tent, enters and waves to Beales, considering the enormit of the duty he's just been given.

dialogues.speaker: STRONGHOLD
dialogues.text: Cacophony of noise and voices. The crowded outdoor Bakara Market is in the center of the city. The young baseball cap wearing Somali (TYE-DIE) we saw pr on the beach now stands before a merchant who wants to se him a machine gun, demonstrating by firing into the air. one even looks over. "Tie-Dye" appears to be more interested in a group of militiamen talking above the stall's belts of ammunition, on the balcony. A door opens behind them and two of Aidid's Lieutenants emerge. The armed militiamen get up and escort the pair p Tie-Dye without a look or word of acknowledgement except last of them, who gives the subtlest of gestures - an alm imperceptible nod.

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: A long-anticipated meeting of Aidid's senior cabinet may take place today at fifteen hundred hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garrison briefs Delta, Black Hawk pilots, and four Ranger chalk leaders, including Eversmann. McKnight, Steele, Cri Matthews and Harrell are in front, the rest behind. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: And I say may, because we all know by now, with the intel we get on the street, nothing is certain. This is actual intel, confirmed by three sources. Two tier one personalities may be present. (points to two enlarged photos) Omar Salad, Aidid's top political advisor; and Abdi Hassan Awale interior minister. These are the guys we're after. Delta let the photos burn into their retinas. Garrison lo at Captain Steele.

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: Today we go. Same mission template as before. Garrison's hand moves past an overhead map of Mogadishu, points to another map: the outline of a general "target uilding." Two building entrances are marked "D" for Delta The men take notes as they listen.

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: 15:45, Assault Force Delta will infiltrate the target building and seize all suspects within. Security Force: Rangers. Four Ranger chalks under the command of Captain Steele will rope in at 15:46... (points to four corners on map) ...and hold a four-corner perimeter around the target building. No one gets in or out. (as McKnight looks on) Extraction Force: Lt. Colonel McKnight's Humvee column will drive into the city at 15:47 On Halwadig Road and hold just short of the Olympic Hotel, here -- (points to the map) Wait for the green light. Now once Delta gives the word, McKnight's column will move to the target building and load the prisoners on flatbed trucks. Immediately after the prisoners are loaded, the four Ranger Chalks will collapse back to the target building, load up on Humvees, and the entire ground force will exfil the three miles back to base. Mission time from incursion to extraction: no longer than 30 minutes. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Garrison, still standing before them, lets this sink in.

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: Now, I had requested light armor and AC-130 Spectre Gunships, but Washington, in all it's wisdom, decide against this. Too high- profile. Black Hawks and Little Birds will provide the air cover with miniguns and 275 rockets. Colonel Harrell? Garrison sits as he glances over at COLONEL HARRELL.

dialogues.speaker: HARRELL
dialogues.text: In_the C 2 Bird: Colonel Matthews will coordinate the air mission, and I will coordinate ground forces. Colonel Matthews? COLONEL MATTHEWS, early forties, speaks up.

dialogues.speaker: MATTHEWS
dialogues.text: Mission launch codeword is Irene. Questions?

dialogues.speaker: HOOT
dialogues.text: Which building is it, sir?

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: Exactly which building we're confirming right now. Somewhere around the Bakara Market. Garrison regards Hoot's reaction, then the others.

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: (primarily to Hoot) I don't choose the time or place of their meetings.

dialogues.speaker: HOOT
dialogues.text: I didn't say a word, Sir. There is an unspoken unease in the room.

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: We're going into the hornet's nest today. You give them time to react and they'll swarm. Make no mistake. Once you're in the Bakara Market, you're in an entirely hostile district. Don't underestimate their capabilities. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Eversmann swallows, checks the others' reactions.

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: Now we'll be going through friendly neighborhoods before we hit the market. So remember the "Rules of Engagement": no one fires unless fired upon. So let's go get this thing done. Good luck, gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group files out. McKnight, the most obviously concern of them, lights a cigarette and slaps closed his Zippo lighter. Eversmann watches from inside the tent as Colone Matthews and Harrell walk up to McKnight.

dialogues.speaker: MATTHEWS
dialogues.text: What's the matter, Danny, something you don't like?

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
dialogues.text: (as if it's nothing) No Spectre gunships, daylight instead of night, late afternoon when they're all fucked up on khat, only part of the city Aidid can mount a serious counter-attack on short notice, what's not to like?

dialogues.speaker: HARRELL
dialogues.text: Life's imperfect.

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
dialogues.text: Yeah, for you two, circling above it at 500 feet, it's imperfect. Down in the street, it's unforgiving. Eversmann continues to watch from inside the tent. He hea it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An alley. Tie-Dye rips lengths of black duct tape and pre them to the roof of his battered car in the shape of an X

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smith plays basketball as Eversmann works at a desk.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: What the fuck, Smith? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Well, what?

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: We going?

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Why should I tell you that?

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Because I'm me.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Three o'clock. Downtown. Bakara market.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Alright.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Listen, Smith. I need you to back me up out there today, all right? Keep sharp.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Yes sir, Sergeant Eversmann.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: All right.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Ev? (hot-Dogs with the basketball) It's gonna be nothing man. Nothing. Smith runs off in to the hangar bouncing the basketball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At a filing cabinet, Grimes carefully pushes the plunger down on the coffee grounds in the coffee pot. He speaks o his shoulder to the only other person in the cluttered of Sizemore.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMES
dialogues.text: It's all in the grind, Sizemore. Can't be too fine, can't be too coarse. This my friend is a science. Turns, holding the coffee pot. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GRIMES
dialogues.text: I mean - you're looking at the guy that believed the commercials, you know? About be all you can be. I made coffee through Desert Storm. I made coffee through Panama, while everyone else got to fight, got to be a Ranger. As Grimes blathers, Sizemore reaches for a letter opener, shoves it down his still-drying cast and scratches away.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMES
dialogues.text: Now it's Grimesy, black, one sugar. Or Grimesy, got a powdered anywhere? Adds just the right amount of sugars. Grimes finally turn and approaches Sizemore, sitting at a desk, trying to itc under the still-wet cast. Hands Sizemore the mug.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMES
dialogues.text: What happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: SIZEMORE
dialogues.text: Ping-pong accident.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMES
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SIZEMORE
dialogues.text: So guess what? Your wish has been granted. You're going out today.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMES
dialogues.text: You're fuckin' me.

dialogues.speaker: SIZEMORE
dialogues.text: You're taking my place assisting the sixty gunner. Sergeant Eversmann said to get your stuff and get ready. Now Grimes is speechless. Sizemore relishes the moment.

dialogues.speaker: SIZEMORE
dialogues.text: It's what you wanted, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: GRIMES
dialogues.text: (gripping his coffee) Oh yeah. Hell, yeah. Grimes is apoplectic. His eyes glaze over with a thousand yard stare. It's exactly what he wanted, but now that it' come to him, he's not at all sure it's what he really wan  34 26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delta and Rangers, in their respective areas, prepare in their own ways, gathering equipment they think they'll ne leaving behind what they don't. Eversmann calls out to Grimes.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Grimsey! I want you to stick with Waddell and give him ammo when he needs it. Hooah?

dialogues.speaker: GRIMES
dialogues.text: (softly) Hooah.

dialogues.speaker: WADDELL
dialogues.text: I wouldn't worry 'bout that. Generally speaking, Somalis can't shoot for snit.

dialogues.speaker: GALENTINE
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it. Just watch out for the Sammies throwing the fucking rocks and you'll be fine. Might even e fun. The other guys snicker at this.

dialogues.speaker: KURTH
dialogues.text: You boys do their thing now. What we gotta do is cover them, choppers gonna cover us. And we'll be all right.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Look you guys, I know this is my first time as ah, Chalk leader... But ah, this is serious. We're Rangers, not some sorry_ass J.R.0O.T.C. We're elite. Let's act like it out there. Hooah? The guys all "hooah".

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Any questions? We're gonna be okay. All right, grab your gear. Let's move out. A few guys "hooah" again, disperse. Eversmann exhales hea INTERCUT, Delta, methodical and precise, no talk: Hoot ta the pins of grenades. Grimes starts to fill a canteen. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: NELSON
dialogues.text: You're not going to need that, dude, we're not out there long enough. Grimes sets it back. Sees YUREK reach for a NOD - Night Observation Device - and reaches for one himself.

dialogues.speaker: TWOMBLY
dialogues.text: Hey you're not going to need that ei her, we're back before dark. You might as well take dope and beer instead. Grimes just stares. Twombly, of course, is kidding.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMES
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: TWOMBLY
dialogues.text: Ammo, dude. Take ammo. Yurek puts the NODs back. Grimes sees Joyce removing the rear panel of his Kevlar vest. Joyce notices Grimes watch

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: Let me tell you something Grimes. You've got about fifty pounds of gear as it is, you don't need another twelve. I_don't know about you but, I'm not planning on getting shot in the back running away.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMES
dialogues.text: Well I better keep mine in.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Hey, Grimes? The most impor tant thing? Just remember when everybody else is shooting, shoot in the same direction. All right. INTERCUT: Eversmann considers Blackburn, who appears more fidgety than before. As Joyce's putting on his armor, he watches Wex across th hangar tearing off pieces of masking tape and writing something on them with a Sharpie. Sticks them to his boot

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: Look at this guy, Lo. Taping his blood type to his boots. It's bad uck.

dialogues.speaker: RUIZ
dialogues.text: No it's smart. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SGT. LORENZO RUIZ pulls out an already addressed and seal envelope, regards it.

dialogues.speaker: RUIZ
dialogues.text: All Delta do that.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: (re: the letter) That's bad luck too, man. Come on, let's go. Ruiz holds the letter. Joyce gets up and walks past him. Ruiz turns to a glum Sizemore.

dialogues.speaker: RUIZ
dialogues.text: It's a good thing you're right handed, Adonis. (mimes like he's jacking off) If not, I don't know what you'd do.

dialogues.speaker: SIZEMORE
dialogues.text: You're a funny guy, man. Ruiz profers the letter to Sizemore.

dialogues.speaker: SIZEMORE
dialogues.text: I'm not taking no death letter.

dialogues.speaker: RUIZ
dialogues.text: (shoves it in his hand) We have a deal.

dialogues.speaker: SIZEMORE
dialogues.text: I'll give it back to you in an hour.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: BLACKBURN
dialogues.text: Excited. In a good way. I've been training my whole life for this.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: You ever shot at anybody before?

dialogues.speaker: BLACKBURN
dialogues.text: No, Sargent. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Me neither. Eversmann pats Blackburn on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: 2:29 PM A Black Hawk hovers over Tie- Dye's battered car.

dialogues.speaker: DAY 37
dialogues.text: Tie-Dye drives along the streets, deeper into the city th the U.N. ever goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Black Hawk hovers high above the car, following.

dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: Garrison and Cribbs watch the image from the C2 chopper, HEAR the annoying music over the command net.

dialogues.speaker: CRIBBS
dialogues.text: Think he's reliable?

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: Well, we'll see. It's his first time out.

dialogues.speaker: DAY 40
dialogues.text: Local pop music jangles on the radio as Tie-Dye drives. H drips with sweat.

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: Tell him to turn his damn radio off.

dialogues.speaker: RADIOMAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. Tell him to turn his radio off.

dialogues.speaker: HARRELL
dialogues.text: Abdu, you need to turn your radio off.  43 44 45 46 47 30.

dialogues.speaker: DAY 43
dialogues.text: Tie-Dye follows the order, switches the radio off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The machine sitting on a counter next to a refrigerator covered with snapshots and reminder notes. A dog listens the outgoing message:

dialogues.speaker: CHILD'S VOICE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Hi, mommy and daddy aren't home. Leave me a message.

dialogues.speaker: SHUGHART, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Hey baby, it's me, you there? Pick up if you're there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shughart is on a satellite phone, huddled against a wall.

dialogues.speaker: SHUGHART
dialogues.text: I'm just calling to check up on you and make sure everything's all right. I'll call in a couple of hours. You better not be sleeping. Gordon moves a chess piece, then passes Shughart still on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: You're move, Randy.

dialogues.speaker: SHUGHART
dialogues.text: I'm missing you. I love you, baby. The call disconnects.

dialogues.speaker: SHUGHART'S WIFE
dialogues.text: Hello, hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eversmann leans against a wall next to Hoot. Silence betw them, Eversmann looks off.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: You know, it's kinda funny. Beautiful beach, beautiful sun... it'd almost be a good place to visit. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Eversmann 31. 47

dialogues.speaker: HOOT
dialogues.text: Almost.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: (off Hoot's tone) You don't think we should be here.

dialogues.speaker: HOOT
dialogues.text: Know what I think? Don't really matter what I think. Once that first bullet goes past your head -- politics, and all that shit -- just goes right out the window.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: I just wanna do it right today.

dialogues.speaker: HOOT
dialogues.text: Just watch your corner...get all your men back here alive. turns to Hoot, grave.

dialogues.speaker: OBSERVATION BIRD PILOT, (V.0.)

dialogues.speaker: TIE-DYE
dialogues.text: Well, it's down the road two blocks around my left.

dialogues.speaker: OBSERVATION BIRD PILOT, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Now he's saying the building's actually a couple blocks down, but if he'sâ€™ seen outside it he'll be shot.

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: I'll fuckin' shoot him myself a couple of blocks down. Tell him I want his skinny ass parked in front of the damn building. He's not getting paid until he does exactly that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McKnight addresses his men.

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
dialogues.text: It's three miles to the target area. We're never off the main roads. In the background, soldiers move and prepare MH-6 Little Birds.

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
dialogues.text: At the K-4 traffic circle we turn north, then east on National. We wait 'til Delta's finished, here. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Then we roll up in force on Halwadig. We load the prisoners and then the assault and blocking forces, and bring 'em back. Home in an hour. Okay? McKnight looks at Pilla, Othic, other gunners.

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
dialogues.text: Now there will be some. shooting. Bakara Market is the Wild West. But be careful_what you shoot at because people do live there. Hooah. Several "hooah" in response as McKnight and the rest up a leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tie-Dye's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: car moves through the streets.

dialogues.text: The last one of these guys shot | himself in the head playing Russian Roulette in a bar.

dialogues.text: Tie-Dye's

dialogues.text: car rattles up to a three-story building. Stops.

dialogues.text: The overhead image on a screen.

dialogues.text: Sir, the vehicle stopped.

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: So this is the real deal now? He's sure this time?

dialogues.speaker: OBSERVATION BIRD PILOT, (V.0.)

dialogues.text: Good. That's always a good sign.

dialogues.text: (into his headset) Irene!

dialogues.text: Rangers deploy across the tarmac to their respective chop Garrison has come out to wish the men well, moving past t open doors of Eversmann's Black Hawk, shouting over the n

dialogues.text: Good luck boys... be careful... no one gets left behind. He gives the thumbs up and leaves. Blackburn and Grimes n Eversmann still looking after the general with some conce

He lifts tip on the controls THE ARMADA ascends, deafening. Little Birds whirl skyward Delta carried aloft outside the choppers, the ultimate th ride. dialogues.text: Mo'Alim! The kid drops the phone. It falls into a waiting pair of hands of an Aidid militia man. He carries the phone in to MO'ALIM, an Aidid lieutenant, sprawled out asleep on a be

dialogues.text: Mo'Alim and his militia arm themselves. Men shout and pas off guns to more men.

Little Birds land in the street. One of the Little Birds streaks in and lands on the roof of the building. Hoot's the other two descend lower, onto the street, the rotors just missing the walls of the building. A dust cloud enve them all. Rangers deploy on the street and the Little Bir swiftly take off. dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delta come through the dust and smoke of flashbangs like apparitions. Hoot, Wex and other Delta burst into a room, see ten Somalia trying to find another escape route. Bett dressed than most Somalis, this group carries file folder maps, charts, scattered on a table, and AK-47s. Bingo.

dialogues.speaker: HOOT
dialogues.text: Down, get down! DOWN! DOWN! DO IT

dialogues.speaker: NOW
dialogues.text: Somalis hit the deck, foot in the back for their troubles they don't do it fast enough. Surrendered weapons clatter the floor.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET 80
dialogues.text: McKnight, now out of his Humvee, peeks calmly around the corner of a building.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Let's go, let's go! The remaining men start roping down. Grimes swallows hard He's next. Crew Chief DOWDY shouts to him: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DOWDY
dialogues.text: No fear!

dialogues.speaker: GRIMES
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, right. With that, Grimes disappears; down the rope sliding into dust and into the gunfire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McKnight's convoy reaches its waiting position just off Halwadig. Pilla, in his turret, hears shots, sees bullets spark off the side of the Humvee.

dialogues.speaker: PILLA
dialogues.text: Colonel, they're shooting at us! Colonel, they're shooting at us!

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
dialogues.text: Well shoot back! A hail of gunfire erupts and Pilla swings the fifty turre Sights a technical racing toward him. He FIRES on it.

dialogues.speaker: OBSERVATION BIRD PILOT, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Super Six Five leaving, going in to holding pattern.

dialogues.speaker: OBSERVATION BIRD PILOT
dialogues.text: Super Six Two, come in. Take up perimeter pattern

dialogues.speaker: OBSERVATION BIRD PILOT
dialogues.text: Roger that. IN THE CHOPPER - still in silence, Blackburn remains.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Go Blackburn, go! Go Blackburn! Just as he says this, Eversmann sees an RPG streaking up them.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: (to Pilot)

dialogues.speaker: RPG
dialogues.text: (to Blackburn) Hold on! The Black Hawk ROCKS to avoid the rocket. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: --BLACKBURN reaches for the rope, sees it swing away and of the grasp of his gloved hands, EVERSMANN stares as the kid FREE FALLS, disappearing into the swirling dust cloud Horrified, Eversmann dives out after him, grabbing onto t rope.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eversmann fast-ropes through the cloud for what seems to forever. Finally, his feet touch down. He scrambles to Blackburn -- having fallen 40 feet to the dirt street.

dialogues.speaker: OBSERVATION BIRD PILOT
dialogues.text: D-2, we got a man fallen.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR
dialogues.text: Six Four, you're a sitting duck there. Get out and take cover pattern.

dialogues.speaker: OBSERVATION BIRD PILOT
dialogues.text: Roger that. Six one leaving. The Black Hawk starts away.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GROUND 84
dialogues.text: Eversmann checks Blackburn who lies still. He and Blackbu are alone in the middle of the street. Over the sharp cra of gunfire --

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Doc! Doc Schmid! Schmid, the medic who benched Sizemore, suddenly appears with his kit from behind Eversmann, startling him.

dialogues.speaker: SCHMID
dialogues.text: Where's he hit?

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: He's not. He fell.

dialogues.speaker: SCHMID
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: He fell!  85 86 41.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grimes dives on his belly, bullets hissing through the ai around him. Waddell is sighting with the SAW, but not fir at a group of fleeting figures down the block.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMES
dialogues.text: Why aren't you shooting?

dialogues.speaker: WADDELL
dialogues.text: We're not being shot at yet.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMES
dialogues.text: How can you tell?

dialogues.speaker: WADDELL
dialogues.text: A hiss means it's close. A snap...

dialogues.speaker: WADDELL
dialogues.text: Now they're shooting at us! Waddell levels withering fire down the street. The fleeti figures scatter. Grimes sees figures with weapons firing at him a block aw He levels his gun and SHOOTS! He's shooting at the enemy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eversmann, in the middle of it with Blackburn, yells acro to his radio man, Galentine. Waves him over.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Galentine! Get me Captain Steele! Get me Captain Steele!

dialogues.speaker: GALENTINE
dialogues.text: Uniform Six Four, this is Uniform Two Five, come in, over. Uniform Six Five, this is Uniform Two Five Two. Schmid moves Blackburn's head -- blood seeping from his n and ears.

dialogues.speaker: GALENTINE
dialogues.text: I can't get him! Galentine doesn't know why. Something wrong with the radi maybe. Eversmann unholsters his walkie-talkie, and as he shouts into it, he can SEE Delta spilling from the first building out into the street. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Juliet Six Four, this is Chalk Four. We got a man down! We gotta get him out of here. Over! EXT. INTERCUT - STEELE'S CHALK ONE - CONT. Steele's men are fanned cut, taking random gunfire. Steel sees the Delta, running down the block toward him and int different building. Eversmann's voice squawks on the walk

dialogues.speaker: STEELE
dialogues.text: Six four, say again, two five, over!

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: He's hurt. He fell. Over.

dialogues.speaker: STEELE
dialogues.text: Take a breath Two Five and calm down! Over!

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Man down!

dialogues.speaker: STEELE
dialogues.text: Missed your last response, again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garrison sits down and watches the overhead image. He rub his temples.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Schmid shouts out to anyone.

dialogues.speaker: SCHMID
dialogues.text: Get me a stretcher! Two men unfold a collapsible litter from a medic pack. Th gingerly place Blackburn on it.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Go!

dialogues.speaker: SCHMID
dialogues.text: Okay, go! They run through a hail of gun fire.  89 90 91 92 93 43.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delta has moved the prisoners out on to the balcony. They kneel facing the wall.

dialogues.speaker: HOOT
dialogues.text: Secure.

dialogues.speaker: SANDERSON
dialogues.text: Let's move out!

dialogues.speaker: HOOT
dialogues.text: Let's go, let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Schmid and his team carry Blackburn on the stretcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delta has marched the prisoners into an inner courtyard. Everyone waiting. Hoot speaks into a walkie talkie --

dialogues.speaker: HOOT
dialogues.text: K.O. Six Four, green light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garrison sits at the panel of screens.

dialogues.speaker: OBSERVATION BIRD PILOT, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Ready for extraction, over.

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: That's it. We're done.

dialogues.speaker: OBSERVATION BIRD PILOT, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Roger that Kilo One One, we'll relay. Uniform Six Four, ready for extraction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McKnight shouts as he leaps into the Humvee:

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
dialogues.text: Roger that. There's the call! Let's move out! Let's move out!

dialogues.speaker: STRUECKER
dialogues.text: Hold on! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Humvee squad rumbles around the corner, rolls down th line. McKnight leads them to a Humvee, starts passing Blackburn inside to a waiting Delta medic. EXT. HALWADIG ROAD - CONT. Gunfire from rooftops across the street force Delta to br out prisoners in contained groups of three. Other Delta r fire, driving back snipers. As soon as one disappears, an sniper pops up.

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
dialogues.text: How much time do you need?

dialogues.speaker: SANDERSON
dialogues.text: Five minutes, Sir!

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SANDERSON
dialogues.text: Five minutes!

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
dialogues.text: You've only got five minutes! McKnight turns around and walks over to Schmid.

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
dialogues.text: What happened to him?

dialogues.speaker: SCHMID
dialogues.text: He fell, missed the rope.

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
dialogues.text: How'd he do that? (off Schmid's shrug) Put him in that op! Hoot comes back out of the target courtyard with Sanderso They move the Somali prisoners out.

dialogues.speaker: HOOT
dialogues.text: Let's go, let's go. Come on, let's move! Blackburn is loaded in to a Humvee. GRIMES has been engrossed in watching them load prisoners (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: When he turns around be sees Schmid, Smith and Waddell WA THE HELL up the street, running back toward Chalk 4. He c see them taking fire as they run, moving from cover to co ON GRIMES - oh shit. He starts charging after them. Barel ets three feet when a rocket explodes near him, gausing i o tumble. Turns and charges back to Chalk One and safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Schmid, Smith and Waddell come charging up, take cover, o of breath from the long, dangerous run. The rest of the chalk are spread out, returning fire. Eversmann hears an approaching Little Bird and glances up As it thunders over him, hot casings splash down like rai burning him.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Oh, fuck! Eversmann pulls a casing out of his flack jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoot marches more prisoners out. Two Somali boys stare at them from the corner like they'r circus attraction.

dialogues.speaker: HOOT
dialogues.text: Let's go, right here! Come on!

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
dialogues.text: (calls out) Struecker! (grabs a radio) Formula C-4, I need to send out a three Humvee with a critical casualty, he looks real bad. I need to evac now!

dialogues.speaker: HARRELL
dialogues.text: Roger that, Uniform Six Four. We'll shot a team of gunships to you, over. INT. TARGET BUILDING - CONT.

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
dialogues.text: Roger that. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: McKnight grabs Sanderson.

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
dialogues.text: I need extra security on these Humvees. Hoot motions for his team. Says to McKnight:

dialogues.speaker: HOOT
dialogues.text: I'll go! I'll take my team, make sure they get back okay.

dialogues.speaker: SANDERSON
dialogues.text: (nods) Sure.

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
dialogues.text: Struecker, you're lead Humvee! SERGEANT STRUECKER, Iowa farm boy, born-again Christian a model Ranger jumps up.

dialogues.speaker: STRUECKER
dialogues.text: Hooah! EXT. TARGET BUILDING - CONT. Strueker is behind the wheel of a Humvee, Blackburn in ba Medic tending to him. Hoot and his team jumps in the Humv Hoot riding shotgun next to Struecker. Struecker hits the gas. The three Humvees take off.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. THE STRUECKER/BLACKBURN CONVOY
dialogues.text: Snipers on the rooftops fire. A hail of shots hits the tr like a cadence of drums. From the Humvees the turret men return fire. Pilla blasts away with his. 50, covering their asses.

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
dialogues.text: How're things going? Are things okay there, Struecker?

dialogues.speaker: STRUECKER
dialogues.text: I don't want to talk about it now, Colonel.

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
dialogues.text: Anyone hit? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Struecker and Hoot see a roadblock. Turns onto another st to avoid it - two other Humvees following - and finds him in a killing zone. Complete chaos. In the turret, Pilla continues to fire. On the street, a Militia Man spin out from behind a corner and shoots Pill in the head. Suddenly the view swings straight up as he's hit in the h flops down into the Humvee, onto a stunned Ranger - Thoma Struecker turns in his seat, sees Pilla bleeding on Thoma who is hysterical.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Christ, he's fucked up!

dialogues.speaker: HOOT
dialogues.text: He's dead.

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
dialogues.text: (into radio) Struecker, talk to me!

dialogues.speaker: STRUECKER
dialogues.text: (long pause, then) It's Sergeant Pilla.

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
dialogues.text: What's his status? What's his status? Hoot turns around in the Humvee, instantly assesses:

dialogues.speaker: HOOT
dialogues.text: He's dead.

dialogues.speaker: STRUECKER
dialogues.text: He's dead. He's dead. McKnight and Steele both look stunned. Someone dead? That just doesn't happen here.

dialogues.speaker: OBSERVATION BIRD PILOT
dialogues.text: The casualties aren't gonna make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garrison glances down briefly, then back up, JOC silent.  100 101 102 103 104 105 48.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stunned hush -- static -- from the speaker. Then bullets hammer the outside of the truck --

dialogues.speaker: STRUECKER
dialogues.text: Someone get on that .50! Hoot is already climbing up into the turret.

dialogues.speaker: HOOT
dialogues.text: It's mine. OUTSIDE - Hoot sights a_line_of Somali gunmen_up ahead an on building tops. Hoot lets loose with a cruel sweep of t -50 caliber. Huge slugs blast into the masonry -- dust and stone mixin with crimson splatters of blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wolcott flies above the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mo'Alim drives a technical in reverse down a tight street keeping pace with Wolcott's circling Black Hawk. Mo'Alim SLAMS the brakes and three Somalia jump out with tubes. Mo'Alim leaps off the vehicle. His men with the RP await his signal. As the chopper turns in the sky --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Busch, Delta sniper, speaks into his headset --

dialogues.speaker: BUSCH
dialogues.text: I got three guys with RPGs coming up on your side now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mo'Alim shouts, his hand drops, and his men FIRE. WHOOOSH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Wolcott can react an RPG BOOMS into the tail rotor Busch's feet shoot out the cargo door.

dialogues.speaker: WOLCOTT
dialogues.text: All right, we got a hit! Stay with it!  106 107 108 109 49.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garrison watches the drifting Black Hawk on a screen.

dialogues.speaker: RADIOMAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Going down, he's hit, he's hit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wolcott and copilot Briley are the picture of calm as gau go blank and the helicopter begins to spin.

dialogues.speaker: WOLCOTT
dialogues.text: Hey, Bull, you wanna pull those PCLs offline or what? Briley, already struggling to pull the levers, returns Wolcott's grin.

dialogues.speaker: BRILEY
dialogues.text: Roger, they're off, Elvis.

dialogues.speaker: WOLCOTT
dialogues.text: (remarkably calm) Six one going down...

dialogues.speaker: FROM EVERYONE'S POSITIONS ON THE GROUND
dialogues.text: Eversmann, McKnight, Steele and others watch from their vantage points as Super Six One drifts away from their fi of view --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bush grips a metal bar with one hand, chopper's spin INTENSIFYING.

dialogues.speaker: WOLCOTT
dialogues.text: Six One going down. Hold on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IMPACT! The Black Hawk explodes into an enormous concrete fountain, flips sideways, slams onto the road, nose burro into the dirt, control panel crumpling, glass shattering inward -- Wolcott and Briley killed instantly. Everything enveloped in dust. Somalis run away in every direction.  50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garrison looks at the screen. Frantic voices on the comma net echo in the room:

dialogues.speaker: VOICES, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: We got a Black Hawk Down! We got a Black Hawk Down! We got a Black Hawk own!

dialogues.speaker: HARRELL
dialogues.text: Super Six one is down! We got a bird down in the city!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Durant scans the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: VOICES, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: We got a Black Hawk Down! We got a Black Hawk Down! FLASH - to Atto in his cell, sitting perfectly still, cig smoke swirling around his head. It's as if he knows what' happened...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON SCREEN - the crash.

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: (into headset) Get an MH-6 on-site, check for survivors. Send in the SAR bird. I want ground forces to move and secure a new perimeter around that crash site. Can you guide the convoy in there?

dialogues.speaker: HARRELL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Ah, Roger that.

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: Well, move quick. The whole damn city will be coming down on top of them. Harrell begins relaying the instructions down the chain t the pilots.

dialogues.speaker: STEEL
dialogues.text: Two Five, this is Six Four, over?  115 116 117 118 119

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eversmann trying to find out what they're supposed to do now.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: This is Two Five, over. EXT. CHALK ONE, HALWADIG ROAD - CONT.

dialogues.speaker: STEELE
dialogues.text: Two Five, Chalk Four is closest to the crash site, over? EXT. CHALK 4 CORNER - CONT.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Six Four. I can't see the crash site. Over. EXT. CHALK ONE, HALWADIG ROAD - CONT. Steele is trying to communicate with Eversmann on the rad

dialogues.speaker: STEELE
dialogues.text: Two Five, it's too East of you. You won't find it. At least secure the area. Repeat, move your chalk on foot to crash. Check for survivors, secure the area. All other chalks will follow, over? (nothing but static) Two Five, you read me, over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eversmann can't take it any longer. Signals to his men.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Goucher, Strick. Get Twombly! Hey, there's a Black Hawk down. Twombly Nelson, you're gonna stay here, you're gonna hold this corner, then exit with the Humvees. Galentine, Schmid, you're coming with me. All right? Let's go! Move out!

dialogues.speaker: NELSON
dialogues.text: How come I gotta stay back here?

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Because you're dependable. All right, let's go. Go! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Eversmann takes off with the rest of his Chalk: Galentine Yurek, Goodale, Kurth, Smith, Doc Schmid, and Waddell.

dialogues.speaker: NELSON
dialogues.text: I hate being dependable, man. Steele looks down the block, sees a distant Eversmann and his Chalk leaving. He can't see Nelson and Twombly behind their cover. Steele thinks the message was received.

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: We just lost the initiative. Garrison stares at the downed Black Hawk on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Militia and irregulars emerge from alleys and buildings a the Bakara Market. As they begin moving east toward the c we RISE UP above the buildings, see some of them parallel the route Eversmann's small group is taking, just one blo over --

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Let's go! As they become exposed around a corner, they take on heav fire. An RPG explodes at their feet. They return fire, th grenades. Little Birds provide cover from the sky, wipe out a Somal machine gunner, clearing the way for Eversmann's chalk.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Go! They run and fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somali snipers are still firing from rooftops across the street. Wex ducks gunfire. SANDERSON BLASTS the rooftops.

dialogues.speaker: WEX
dialogues.text: We've still got guys inside.

dialogues.speaker: SANDERSON
dialogues.text: All right, all right, I'm going to go to the crash. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WEX
dialogues.text: Okay. You take the rest of the team; I'll finish loading the prisoners. Steele shouts to be heard.

dialogues.speaker: STEELE
dialogues.text: Negative! We proceed to the crash site together | Secure the perimeter and wait for the Humvees! Roger, Sir!

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
dialogues.text: Roger that.

dialogues.speaker: STEELE
dialogues.text: I'll take the lead. Sanderson stares down the block, impatient.

dialogues.speaker: STEELE
dialogues.text: Sir, are you receiving me?

dialogues.speaker: SANDERSON
dialogues.text: I heard you. We should be leaving, sir. As if to punctuate his point, an RPG nicks the hood of a Humvee and explodes against the target building. Othic an Joyce duck, McKnight doesn't. Debris rains down on the Ra of Chalk One and Delta men.

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
dialogues.text: All right, we need to move out now! I'll finish loading the prisoners, pick you up at the crash site.

dialogues.speaker: MEN
dialogues.text: (in unison) Roger!

dialogues.speaker: STEELE
dialogues.text: Let's move out!

dialogues.speaker: SANDERSON
dialogues.text: Come on, let's go! Chalk One and Delta element begin moving on foot toward t distant crash. McKnight loads up the prisoners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steele and his men are in the lead, Delta behind. In the rear, hugging the walls, is Grimes. Sanderson yells back (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SANDERSON
dialogues.text: Hey, hey! Stay away from the walls, whoever you are! But the walls seem safe to Grimes. He's not getting away from them even if his life depended on it, which it does. chugs along behind the Delta to keep up as -- He hears a loud FWOOOSH!, turns to see -- AN RPG, streaking right at him. Grimes DUCKS behind a low wall as it ricochets and - BA-WHOOM! -- hits right above his head. Sanderson stops firing, looks back at Grimes who appears behind him.

dialogues.speaker: SANDERSON
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: GRIMES
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McKnight and Maddox jump in the Humvee and take off with Somali prisoners.

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
dialogues.text: Let's go, Maddox! Maddox, look at these little skinny bastards! You muther fuckers! Go, go, go, left, left, left, left! Maddox steers with his shoulders hunched in fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nelson and Twombly, left behind at Chalk 4, are crouched behind a burned-out technical, reloading. There are bodie of Somali gunmen around it. A Black Hawk flies overhead.

dialogues.speaker: NELSON
dialogues.text: Twombly? Twombly!

dialogues.speaker: TWOMBLY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: NELSON
dialogues.text: I think they've forgotten us!

dialogues.speaker: TWOMBLY
dialogues.text: What? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: NELSON
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garrison watches the grainy images from P3 Orion as Somal militia run towards the downed Black Hawk.

dialogues.speaker: OBSERVATION BIRD PILOT, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Indigenous personnel move to the crash.

dialogues.speaker: CRIBBS
dialogues.text: Say again, over?

dialogues.speaker: OBSERVATION BIRD PILOT, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: A lot of people closing in.

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: How far is Chalk Four from the crash site?

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: About six blocks, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Well they need to haul ass!

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT WOLCOTT'S BLACK HAWK
dialogues.text: Wolcott is dead. Dan Busch crawls out of the wreckage. He fires, trying to keep Somali gunmen from the downed chopp Targets pop up. Everywhere. Busch hits every one, pluggin rounds into the fleeting forms of armed Militia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garrison watches gunfire on the screen around the crash s EXT. CRASH SITE - CONT. Busch takes a bullet in the knee and nearly goes down.

dialogues.speaker: NEARBY
dialogues.text: The chalk splits, moves to opposite sides of the street. Gunfire erupts from the corner, Yurek, Kurth and Galentin running for a burned-out car. Galentine drops his weapon he dives for cover.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Scotty! Scotty, are you okay? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Across the street, Eversmann watches, then glances ahead sees the tip of a rifle poke out from behind the edge of building. Glancing back, he sees Galentine, obviously about to run back out to retrieve his weapon in the middle of the stre

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: No! Don't go! Galentine can't hear or can't understand and hurries out. cover him, Eversmann has to step into the street, firing the edge of the building. They continue moving. Then a Technical comes up behind th bullets flying. Galentine looks at his hand, covered with blood. His thum is hanging by a thread of skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eversmann and the others are firing nearly nonstop. It's chaos.

dialogues.speaker: YUREK
dialogues.text: Go, go, go! Eversmann crosses the street, ducks behind Yurek. Fires i that direction. Yurek signals the others to move.

dialogues.speaker: YUREK
dialogues.text: Go! Go! The rest of the group continues along the block as Yurek cover fires at the approaching mob. He turns to follow th as KRATAKRATAKRAK! AK-47 gunfire wails down at Yurek, he kic in the tin door of the nearest structure he can find, div into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- a cramped schoolroom, cluttered with terrified kids huddling in a corner with their 16 year-old teacher. Bullets EXPLODE through the tin door. Bullets ZING! through the tin, explode around the room. Yurek puts his finger over his mouth to be quiet. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The teacher stares at him, nods. She gets the message. Yurek sees a back door. Moves over to it. Turns to the ki waves. One child waves back, smiles at him. Peeks out. Clear. Steps outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pokes his head out to check the Street. Looks both ways a A SOMALI GUNMAN fires at him from one direction as -- The Somali's TEN YEAR OLD son, AK-47 too big for his little h FIRES from the other direction, poorly aimed bullets ricocheting off the crumbling alley wall, just missing Yu a bullet taking the heel of his boot off. Yurek pulls his head back just in time as -- The SOMALI M groans, hit by ricochet of his son's bullets. The man cru to the dirt, dying. Yurek sees the kid run past him to his father, on his kne over his father, wailing, AK-47 forgotten. Yurek holds hi gun on dying father and son. About to fire. Doesn't. Then runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The McKnight Humvee convoy starts up Halwadig. A voice crackles through the radio:

dialogues.speaker: OBSERVATION BIRD PILOT, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Unit One, this is Six Four, you have to slow down.

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
dialogues.text: Romeo, Six Four, I need to know before I get to the god damned street!

dialogues.speaker: OBSERVATION BIRD PILOT
dialogues.text: You have to slow down, there's a delay from the time directions are relayed from P-3, to JOC, then to me.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE MCKNIGHT'S HUMVEE 134
dialogues.text: McKnight yells back through the radio. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
dialogues.text: We can't slow down! We're taking heavy enemy fire! We can't slow down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sizemore is among thirty technicians, mechanics and cooks all gathered around a big radio, listening with dawning h at the drama out there.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL GARRISON
dialogues.text: (standing, to Cribbs) What in the hell is the status of Struecker's Humvees?

dialogues.speaker: CRIBBS
dialogues.text: General Harrell, ETA to base, Strueker's column?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The convoy rumbles down the road. Thomas holds a bloody P Hoot stands at the turret gun, no longer firing -- in a d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Busch leans against the chopper wall surrounded by a doze dead Somali gunmen shot at close range. Busch's face is g Blood streams down his nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SILENCE. Garrison watches the Orion plane's grainy image Maier landing his Little Bird at the crash site.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dust storm kicks up as Maier and his copilot Jones set Little Bird down in front of Wolcott's crashed Black Hawk

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eversmann and his guys come around the corner. Through a massive city archway, they can see Wolcott's downed chopp lying on its side. Little Bird whirling in front of it. Eversmann motions for his men to follow him. They charge through the enormous city gate, bullets slapping around t  142 143 59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clark and Jones run toward the crash from their Little Bi Finds Busch leaning against the Black Hawk, weapon aimed. Jones and Clark throw Busch's arm over their shoulders, a the three move to the chopper. Somali gunfire raining aro them.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Galentine, you alright? (Galentine nods) Covering fire! Go!

dialogues.speaker: GALENTINE
dialogues.text: We'll cover! Eversmann and his team run in to the crash site. They are now in an enormous open area, four roads leading out -- f possible lanes of fire to worry about. Jones and Clarke get the limp Dan Busch into the Little B as Eversmann charges over, shouts:

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Hey, how many are in there?

dialogues.speaker: JONES
dialogues.text: Two pilots are dead. Two crew chiefs are wounded. This guy's hurt bad. We gotta get out of here, now!

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Okay. Jones helps Clarke inside, jumps in, Maier lifting off in the swirling dust as RPGs explode around the Little Bird. Eversmann crouches low, bullets pinging around him as he dashes to the downed chopper. Sees Wolcott's dead body. The Little Bird flies away. A Technical ROARS down the street. A Ranger shoots a rock at it. It bursts into flames as Eversmann sprints from Wolcott's Black Hawk, joins Smith and Goodale in a mortar cavity carved into a wall.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: (into radio) Two Six, Two Six, this is Two Five. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: The guys_are shooting up the technicals, over! EXT. CORNER NEAR WOLCOTT CRASH SITE - CONT. As Di Tomasso's Chalk 3 arrives at one of the cross stree he answers Eversmann.

dialogues.speaker: DI TOMASSO
dialogues.text: Two Six, Two Six, roger that!

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Di Tomasso! Take the Southeast border, we'll set up a perimeter, over?

dialogues.speaker: DI TOMASSO
dialogues.text: Delta two Six, Roger that. Moving my men out. Move out! Di Tomasso nods and waves his men to a structure on the Southeast corner. They move and take immediate heavy fire

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Captain Steele, Captain Steele, come in!

dialogues.speaker: STEELE
dialogues.text: Eversmann Go ahead Two Five, this is Six Four!

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: We got two wounded and we got both the pilots dead in the chopper. We need a medivac over here now!

dialogues.speaker: STEELE
dialogues.text: Two Five, they're telling me it's too hot to land the birds. You gotta secure the perimeter first, over.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Where are the Humvees?

dialogues.speaker: STEELE
dialogues.text: Advise Two Five the convoy will be there. They're encountering light resistance. Six Four out. signals to Kurth.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Kurth! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KURTH
dialogues.text: Let's go! They move out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STRUECKER'S THREE HUMVEES PULL IN to the Hangar area. Hun swarm toward them.

dialogues.speaker: RANGER
dialogues.text: Hey, we need a medic! Hey, we need a medic immediately to get this last load in! Bloody bodies are carried out of the Humvees on stretcher Sizemore, cast on his arm, watches as Pilla is taken out, dead. Blackburn, broken. Half the others, bleeding. IN A HUMVEE -- Hoot's head peers in. There's already the buzzing of flies over the pools of blood and gristle.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. MCKNIGHT'S CONVOY
dialogues.text: Light resistance? It's the fucking end of the world -- sw of bullets raking the Humvee squad, RPGs streaking by wit deadly whispers, exploding into walls. A .50 gunner slump down in the turret, hit.

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
dialogues.text: Get the .50 up! God dammit! A Ranger tries, can't get through the bodies blocking the way.

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
dialogues.text: All I see is a roadblock.

dialogues.speaker: HARRELL
dialogues.text: Alright, I'm going to have to figure out another way. ON THE HUMVEE BEHIND - an RPG hits the back of the vehicl flinging Alberto Rodriguez, Wex and another man into the street like unwanted toys during a child's tantrum.

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
dialogues.text: (leaping out, shouts) Give me a defensive perimeter so we can load the wounded! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Joyce, Kowalewski and other Rangers leap out, firing at . windows, doorways, rooftops. Othic near y steps on a hand the street, doesn't know whose it is. He'll figure it out later; puts it in his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: RANGER
dialogues.text: Fire your weapon, Othic! McKnight comes upon the writhing Wex. The Delta Operator no lower half of his body. Wex is muttering something, somehow still alive, reaching at McKnight, taking his hand and squeezing.

dialogues.speaker: WEX
dialogues.text: Tell my girls they'll be okay. McKnight watches him die. Then yells out.

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
dialogues.text: Othic! Othic runs low -- to McKnight's side.

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
