dialogues.text: Medic! Othic and a medic carry Wex, put him inside the Humvee.. Joyce returns fire. Then takes a shot in the back where h removed the vest panel. Crumples to the street. Kowalewski and McKnight drag Joyce's limp body toward the trucks.

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Get us off this fucking street! (into radio) Where's the crash site? Say again?

dialogues.speaker: HARRELL
dialogues.text: Keep going straight 200 meters.

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Okay. INT. MCKNIGHT'S HUMVEE - CONT. McKnight hops into the cab, bullets again exploding into convoy, SHOUTS to Maddox - (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
dialogues.text: Let's go, let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Nelson and Twombly, left behind at Chalk 4, are crouched in their bunker, reloading. There are bodies of Somali gunmen around it. But now, there is nothing but sporadic gunfire on the cor Nelson glances back down the block toward the target hous

dialogues.speaker: NELSON
dialogues.text: Hey, Twombles?

dialogues.speaker: TWOMBLY
dialogues.text: What? Twombly stands and moves over to Nelson.

dialogues.speaker: NELSON
dialogues.text: Come here! The Humvees ain't coming back, dude.

dialogues.speaker: TWOMBLY
dialogues.text: Really? Were we supposed to go to them?

dialogues.speaker: NELSON
dialogues.text: I thought they were supposed to come to us.

dialogues.speaker: TWOMBLY
dialogues.text: Shit, I think we were supposed to go to them.

dialogues.speaker: NELSON
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: TWOMBLY
dialogues.text: Okay, let's go to the crash site.

dialogues.speaker: NELSON
dialogues.text: Okay. Just don't fire that thing so close to my head. I can barely hea as it is.

dialogues.speaker: TWOMBLY
dialogues.text: Okay, move out. Nelson goes first. He makes it half a block before bullet start ticking the walls around him. Twombly covers. Nelso dives behind another smoldering automobile carcass, turns and covers as Twombly dives in beside him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 150 151 152 153 Suddenly an armed figure appears across the street; Twomb fires inches from Nelson's head. The gunman falls as the enormous boom of the SAW rings in Nelson's ears. He yells

dialogues.speaker: GOD IF YOU EVER...
dialogues.text: Another figure appears, and Twombly has to fire again.

dialogues.speaker: NELSON
dialogues.text: (in pain)

dialogues.speaker: TWOMBLY
dialogues.text: You okay? You alright?

dialogues.speaker: NELSON
dialogues.text: (can't hear a thing - shouting) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Militia with RPGs strapped to their backs climb steps for better angle on the hovering Six Eight Black Hawk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Black Hawk takes fire.

dialogues.speaker: SIX EIGHT PILOT
dialogues.text: Sunnavabitch. C2, this is Six Eight, we've been hit.

dialogues.speaker: HARRELL
dialogues.text: (into radio) Super Six Eight, there is smoke coming from the top of your rotor. Advise you to come out now.

dialogues.speaker: SIX EIGHT PILOT
dialogues.text: Roger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Somalis set up to fire their RPGs at the Black Hawk.  154 155 156 157 158 65.

dialogues.speaker: SIX EIGHT PILOT
dialogues.text: Art, I've got skinnies with RPG's at 12 o'clock, can you see them? Rangers slide down the ropes.

dialogues.speaker: RANGER 2
dialogues.text: Go, go!

dialogues.speaker: SIX EIGHT GUNNER
dialogues.text: Got 'em. Give me 90 degrees left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're about to fire as the Black Hawk banks. Relentless machine gun fire from the Black Hawk mows them down insid the building.

dialogues.speaker: SIX EIGHT PILOT
dialogues.text: Six Eight, coming out. He banks the chopper away.

dialogues.speaker: HARRELL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Super Six Eight is out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eversmann runs for cover behind upended trucks.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Galentine! What's the situation in there?

dialogues.speaker: GALENTINE
dialogues.text: Both pilots are dead.

dialogues.speaker: WILKINSON
dialogues.text: (into radio) Two Five, we can't move these guys now. We'll kill 'em just carrying â€˜em. (to other Medic) Stabilize in here?

dialogues.speaker: GALENTINE
dialogues.text: Roger ! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WILKINSON
dialogues.text: Stabilize in here. Repeat, stabilize in the bird, over.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Understood Wilky, we got you covered, over.

dialogues.speaker: HARRELL
dialogues.text: (into radio) Super Six Four, come in and take Wolcott's position.

dialogues.speaker: DURANT
dialogues.text: Roger. Six Four's inbound. He banks back toward the city center. Passes over rooftop

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Militants with RPGs fire at Durant's chopper. An RPG missile streaks into Durant's chopper's tail. The Black Hawk rocks violently from the hit. The gauges blink but stay lit. Durant hears in his headset -

dialogues.speaker: HARRELL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Super Six Four, you all right?

dialogues.speaker: DURANT
dialogues.text: This is Super Six Four. We're good.

dialogues.speaker: HARRELL
dialogues.text: You sure? You look like you got clipped pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Durant and his copilot, Frank, check the gauges again. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DURANT
dialogues.text: Instrument panels are okay. No, we're good. Got a slight vibration in the pedals. But we're good.

dialogues.speaker: HARRELL
dialogues.text: All right. Put it down on the airfield, Super Six Four, have it checked out. Just to be safe.

dialogues.speaker: DURANT
dialogues.text: Roger. Durant banks away from the crash site, heads south toward base, grid of narrow streets and alleys rushing beneath h OUTSIDE, the bent tail rotor is looser and rattling loude

dialogues.speaker: DURANT
dialogues.text: Hey Ray, I'm getting a lot of movement in these pedals. Check the systems.

dialogues.speaker: SUDDENLY
dialogues.text: THE ROTOR PIN PULLS FREE, slices through the gear box, an the entire tail assembly evaporates in a blur. Inside, there's a high whine as the airframe vibrates. Du tries to correct the spin with the pedals; Frank kills th power with the ceiling levers.

dialogues.speaker: DURANT
dialogues.text: We lost the tail rudder! Six Four's going down. Six Four going down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SILENCE... Garrison watches the Orion plane's grainy imag of Durant's Black Hawk crashing. Eyes locked on the monit MONITOR - Durant's chopper hits the ground, crumpling, tw into the dirt like a whale on the beach, main rotor still chopping at the air like a gasp. After stunned silence in the JOC, Garrison finally speaks (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: Get Struecker's column back up there. They need to get to Durant's crash site, fast.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR
dialogues.text: I'm on it.

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: All of them.

dialogues.speaker: HARRELL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Super Six Four is down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Militiamen and Rangers exchange gunfire. Eversmann glance over at Galentine, ghostly white, listening to his radio.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: What? Then Eversmann's hip radio squawks, and he hears the voic on the command net:

dialogues.speaker: RADIO VOICES
dialogues.text: Bird down! Super Six Four is down. Eversmann, looks at the faces of his chalk.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: They talking about another hawk? His men nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steele and his thirty some Rangers have entered a killing zone. Spread all over the road, his men are pinned down b gunfire from a fourth floor window in a building around t corner. They can't move forward down the street. DOWN THE STREET - Sanderson and his Delta (and Grimes) ar pinned down, waiting to move. Sanderson shouts through th walkie talkie:

dialogues.speaker: SANDERSON
dialogues.text: Captain Steele, we gotta move or we're gonna get pinned down!

dialogues.speaker: STEELE
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: STEELE
dialogues.text: We're moving as fast as we can! You let me do my job and you do yours! Over!

dialogues.speaker: SANDERSON
dialogues.text: We're gonna get chewed up if we don't get off this street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruiz fires when he's suddenly lifted and thrown against a wall, blood spraying out his back, bullet entering just u is vest.

dialogues.speaker: RUIZ
dialogues.text: Fuck! Fuck! Fuck, fuck, I fucking knew I was gonna get shot ! Steele and his Rangers are still pinned down. Steele hove over Ruiz.

dialogues.speaker: STEELE
dialogues.text: Medic! A Ranger MEDIC crouches along the street, gunfire blastin over his head. Starts working on Ruiz. DOWN THE BLOCK - as bullets whiz past he and his Delta te SANDERSON mutters to himself --

dialogues.speaker: SANDERSON
dialogues.text: Fuck this. (into radio) Cap'n Steele, we'll take out the window, we'li rally point at the gray building. Coming through, aptain! ON STEELE - he looks back at Sanderson and Delta down the block behind him.

dialogues.speaker: STEELE
dialogues.text: Sergeant!

dialogues.speaker: SANDERSON
dialogues.text: All right, let's move, let's move! SANDERSON clicks off the radio. Gives Delta command by ha signals. The Delta team moves down the block. Grimes looks behind him. No one there. He takes a deep br and hustles after Delta. ON STEELE - his position is under BLISTERING fire. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sanderson and Delta - pass Steele and his beleaguered Ran without a second glance. Grimes keeps following Delta. KRATAKRATAKRAK! Bullets immediately track the Delta team from the fourth floor window.

dialogues.speaker: SANDERSON
dialogues.text: Move! Move! Move! As DELTA move in a crouch alongside a five foot high eart mound. Bullets kick up plumes of dirt along the crest of the mou above Delta's heads as -- SANDERSON pulls a grenade, yanks the pin and runs up the earthen mound, hurls the grenade four stories into the op window -- a perfect toss. A MOMENT LATER -- the room explodes, shredded Somali bodi hurtling outward. More bullets rain at them from every direction:

dialogues.speaker: SANDERSON
dialogues.text: Let's go! Let's move! Grimes runs along the earthen mound again. More bullets r past him as he runs. Steele and his Rangers follow the Deltas.

dialogues.speaker: STEELE
dialogues.text: Move it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullets rain down on Delta from every conceivable directi as they sprint to the first cover they can find. Sanderso is behind them and dives into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A STABLE - no living animals here. Carcasses, bones, pile of moldering hay, ratty couch in a corner. High stone courtyard walls protect them from Somali bullets. Grimes, covered in concrete powder, runs inside.

dialogues.speaker: SANDERSON
dialogues.text: Come on, come on! Let's go, let's go! Come on, bring 'em down!  71.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT STEELE'S STABLE COURTYARD
dialogues.text: As Steele and other Rangers spill into the filthy stable courtyard an RPG blasts the building Rangers are help pin wounded comrades through the doorway, while groups of oth carry seriously wounded men.

dialogues.speaker: SANDERSON
dialogues.text: Grab him! Move him! Move him out of here! Go, go, go! Steele whirls on SANDERSON, furious.

dialogues.speaker: STEELE
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you doing out there?

dialogues.speaker: SANDERSON
dialogues.text: Doing my job! Look, we gotta get to that crash site! We gotta get on that street and we gotta move! Now you have got to keep up, Sir! Steele says under his breath so the others won't hear:

dialogues.speaker: STEELE
dialogues.text: (livid) We are combat ineffective. We've got too many dang wounded to move.

dialogues.speaker: SANDERSON
dialogues.text: Then give me some of your shooters and it at'll get us closer to the ird! Steele nods. His eyes travel around the room. His Rangers are blood spattered, dazed, shell-shocked. Most are frank terrified. His gaze falls on Grimes.

dialogues.speaker: STEELE
dialogues.text: Grimes! You're with Chalk Four! Grimes flinches.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMES
dialogues.text: Yes, Sir! Steele speaks to his Rangers, but he's looking right at Sanderson as he says:

dialogues.speaker: STEELE
dialogues.text: All right, who's going with Delta? Grimes joins with Sergeant Eversmann. Grimes' face falls. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: STEELE
dialogues.text: The rest of you men secure the position. Treat the wounded, and we'll wait for the convoy. Then we'll rally at the crash site. Roger! The other Rangers breathe a sigh of relief. Sanderson giv Grimes a once over. Shakes his head. This is who he gets? Finally he sighs, grabs his weapon.

dialogues.speaker: SANDERSON
dialogues.text: My guys, let's go!

dialogues.speaker: STEELE
dialogues.text: All right, let's cover him! A look from SANDERSON is all Delta needs to let them know they're moving out. They start filing back out into the dangerous streets. Grimes heads to the door, uncertain. With a last look bac at Steele, Grimes readies himself. Then he runs after Del

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanderson and Delta emerge from the stable, Grimes traili Delta are fluid, moving from cover to cover, fanning out either side of the street. Grimes hustles after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Strapped to the seat of his downed Black Hawk, D slowly comes to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Circling, Goffena and his copilot Yacone can see Durant's downed Black Hawk below. In back, also looking down at it, are Delta snipers Shugh and Gordon. There's a crowd moving toward the crash from several bloc away.

dialogues.speaker: GOFFENA
dialogues.text: Romeo; Six Two. I got two Delta snipers volunteering to go in to secure Crash Site 2, over. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MATTHEWS, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: No, Six Two, that is negative to the request.

dialogues.speaker: MATTHEWS
dialogues.text: We don't see anything moving down there now. We don't even know if anyone's alive. A ground team is being organized to go in now.

dialogues.speaker: GOFFENA
dialogues.text: ETA of ground team, over?

dialogues.speaker: MATTHEWS
dialogues.text: Ah, unknown. Not long. Do what you can from the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still trapped to his seat, Durant sees through the shatte windshield the Black Hawk flying overhead.

dialogues.speaker: STRUECKER
dialogues.text: All right, gather around! All right, Durant's Six Four is down. (Rangers mutter in anger ) We're going back in to get â€˜em. Now there is a prolonged silence. Rangers look at him lik he's nuts. Three Humvees behind him are bloody Swiss chee

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: That's crazy! Is there anyone alive on that? Thomas looks at other Rangers, some just as scared as he

dialogues.speaker: STRUECKER
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter. No one gets left behind. You know that.

dialogues.speaker: HOOT
dialogues.text: We're wasting time here.

dialogues.speaker: STRUECKER
dialogues.text: All right! Refit, max out ammo and grenades. You've got five. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SIZEMORE is gearing up, wearing unlaced boots, swimming i an enormous extra flak vest.

dialogues.speaker: STRUECKER
dialogues.text: Sizemore, where the hell do you think you're going?

dialogues.speaker: SIZEMORE
dialogues.text: With you guys.

dialogues.speaker: STRUECKER
dialogues.text: Not with that cast on you're not. Sizemore pulls out his survival knife and goes to cut off his cast.

dialogues.speaker: STRUECKER
dialogues.text: All right, all right, all right. Go get your K-pak. Struecker moves off to get ammo and sees Thomas' worried face.

dialogues.speaker: STRUECKER
dialogues.text: Hey, talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I can't go back out there.

dialogues.speaker: STRUECKER
dialogues.text: Thomas, everyone feels the same way you do, all right? It's what you do right now that makes a difference. It's your call. Hooah! Struecker walks off.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Hooah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoot slaps in a magazine, already re -- supplied with gre and ammo. He grabs a bunch of night vision goggles, slips them in a pack. Rangers stare at him. Struecker is grabbing ammo when Hoot pulls him aside.

dialogues.speaker: HOOT
dialogues.text: It'll probably help to wash the blood out of the Humvees.  183 184 75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Struecker's Humvees are slowly pulling out, everyone, fro company cooks to mechanics running after it, geared up wi borrowed armor, leaping on, wanting to join in the fight. Thomas watches Struecker's loaded Humvee.

dialogues.speaker: BASE RANGER
dialogues.text: (running alongside) Sergeant Struecker, wait! Sergeant Struecker! Can I go, Sir?

dialogues.speaker: STRUECKER
dialogues.text: You got some ammo? (the Ranger does) Hop in. Struecker looks back at Thomas. Thomas, taking a hit from his inhaler, finally summons th courage, runs to catch up.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Sergeant! Pulls the door open and jumps in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nelson and Twombly, still looking for crash site one, cha to a corner. The random burst of gunfire keeps them on ed

dialogues.speaker: TWOMBLY
dialogues.text: Which way? Twombly shrugs: which way? He motions down the street, le or right? Nelson looks down the street.

dialogues.speaker: NELSON
dialogues.text: (shouting) That way I think.

dialogues.speaker: TWOMBLY
dialogues.text: (whispering) Sshh! Don't talk so fucking loud! Twombly hears something, coming down the block, a strange sound. -- clop, clack, clop. Motions Nelson back. Sound growing louder, closer. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Eyes wide, Twombly aims his SAW as --A DONKEY comes clopp past, pulling a cart without a driver. The animal briskly trots past Twombly, who nearly blew it head off. Twombly motions to Nelson. They RUN. DOWN THE BLOCK - on a different corner, YUREK is pressed against an alley wall, terrified, alone, eyes wide. Hears ghostly, disturbing sound, coming closer -- clop, clop, c Yurek prepares himself, gun aimed. The same donkey comes clattering into the alley, walks right up to the stunned Yurek.

dialogues.speaker: YUREK
dialogues.text: Nice donkey. Yurek pats its head as he takes a look out into the wide intersection. Then he bolts -- RUNNING around a corner, d another block, around another corner. TWOMBLY AND NELSON level their weapons at him and start shooting.

dialogues.speaker: YUREK
dialogues.text: Rangers!

dialogues.speaker: NELSON
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: YUREK
dialogues.text: It's Yurek, you fucking assholes!

dialogues.speaker: TWOMBLY
dialogues.text: Fuck! No, we almost fucking killed you! Oh, come to us! Yurek, completely out of breath; tries to speak.

dialogues.speaker: YUREK
dialogues.text: Fuck You! Come to me! Twombly and Nelson run to Yurek.

dialogues.speaker: NELSON
dialogues.text: Sorry Sarge.

dialogues.speaker: TWOMBLY
dialogues.text: Okay, never mind. You brought the NOD, right? Yurek gives him a weary Look. Gasps out -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: YUREK
dialogues.text: No. No, I didn't bring it. And you want to know why? â€˜Cause you said: You're not gonna need that, dude, we'll be back in a half hour.

dialogues.speaker: TWOMBLY
dialogues.text: Man, I wasn't saying it to you.

dialogues.speaker: YUREK
dialogues.text: (looks at Nelson) Nelson, cover this way. Nelson doesn't hear him.

dialogues.speaker: TWOMBLY
dialogues.text: Man, we're gonna need night vision. Yurek grabs Nelson. Nelson turns around.

dialogues.speaker: YUREK
dialogues.text: What's the matter with you?

dialogues.speaker: NELSON
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: TWOMBLY
dialogues.text: Oh, he's deaf. It's my fault, I... We really need to get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: YUREK
dialogues.text: We can't be far from the crash. Which way?

dialogues.speaker: TWOMBLY
dialogues.text: I thought you might know. They take off down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eversmann's men are shooting constantly, trying to keep t growing crowd of Somalis from the downed chopper.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: (To Galentine) Give me Nelson and Twombly now! Galentine nods and clicks the handset of his radio, shout over the sounds of gunfire. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GALENTINE
dialogues.text: Nelson... Twombly, come in! This is Galentine. Over. Nelson, Twombly, come in, this is Galentine! We need the position of the convoy, over? Galentine shouts in frustration:

dialogues.speaker: GALENTINE
dialogues.text: I can't raise them, Sergeant! I can't raise them! Eversmann swears under his breath as bullets EXPLODE over his head.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: We gotta get the fuck out of here and evac!

dialogues.speaker: GOODALE
dialogues.text: No, we can't move â€œem. We're staying right here until the convoy gets here! Understood? (to all his men) We stay with the plan. Understood?

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Let's get back to the stronghold! Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cribbs points to the map of Mogadishu. A big X represents Wolcott's crash, another, further away, Durant's crash.

dialogues.speaker: CRIBBS
dialogues.text: Ground forces have occupied several buildings along Marehan Road -- they re all spread out. Eversmann's Chalk Four has set up a perimeter around Wolcott's crash site, here. (marks a spot) Id Tomasso is in the adjacent structure. (marks a more distant spot) Captain Steele and about forty men of Rangers are here, a couple blocks away. They're banged up pretty bad. He's set up a casualty collection oint. I, don't think they're gonna e able to move. Sergeant Sanderson and a small Delta team are moving from Steele's position to the crash site as we speak.  187 188 79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanderson is behind wreckage made by a mortar blast. He s Grimes near him, wonders briefly where he came from.

dialogues.speaker: SANDERSON
dialogues.text: When this guy stops firing, I'll have four seconds to get to their corner. Cover me. Go! Grimes nods as bullets SLAM into the wall above them. Gri runs forward. The gunfire pauses. Before Sanderson can move, Grimes has leapt out of the cr

dialogues.speaker: GRIMES
dialogues.text: I got it! GRIMES - charging the corner, seemingly taking forever to get there. He rounds the corner and comes face to face wi TwO SOMALI gunman, frantically trying to change magazines they see Grimes sliding to a stop before them. They slap the mags, raise their weapons, but -- Grimes waves a burs of gunfire over them.

dialogues.speaker: SANDERSON
dialogues.text: (shouting)

dialogues.speaker: RPG
dialogues.text: An RPG slams into the wall behind Grimes, burying him in debris. This time he must be dead. Sanderson charges to the mound of rubble, tossing aside t pound chunks of mortar and concrete. Sanderson pulls Grim out, dazed, hair blackened, helmet gone.

dialogues.speaker: SANDERSON
dialogues.text: (CONT'D) You all right? You okay, man?

dialogues.speaker: GRIMES
dialogues.text: Yeah! I can hear bells ringing. Sanderson gives Grimes a nod and a thumbs up.

dialogues.speaker: SANDERSON
dialogues.text: (laughs) Come on, come on! Let's go! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sanderson helps Grimes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crowd scatters from the low-flying Black Hawk but then reforms again, heading toward Durant's crashed chopper. Goffena sweeps around to make another pass.

dialogues.speaker: GOFFENA
dialogues.text: Romeo, Shughart and Gordon again request permission to secure until convoy arrives, over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garrison watches crowds of Somalis charge down the street the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthews can barely hear Goffena over the frantic_voices the command net. He reaches out and SHUTS down all radio channels. Silence except for rotors. Speaks to Harrell:

dialogues.speaker: HARRELL
dialogues.text: General, crowd's in the hundreds now. From where they are, they can see it clearer than any of us. They know what they're asking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence except for the static. finally --

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: Let me talk to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shughart and Gordon hear over their headsets --

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: This is Garrison. I want to make sure that ya'll understand what you're asking for so say it out loud.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: We're asking to go in to set upa perimeter until ground support arrives. INTERCUT to Garrison - (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: Now you understand I can not tell you when that might be. It could take quite a while.

dialogues.speaker: SHUGHART
dialogues.text: Roger that.

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: And you still want to go in?

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE JOC
dialogues.text: Garrison chews on this for a moment. Then:

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: Colonel Harrell.

dialogues.speaker: HARRELL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Yes, General.

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: It's your call.

dialogues.speaker: HARRELL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Roger that. Goffena? Put â€˜em in.

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN GOFFENA'S BLACK HAWK
dialogues.text: Goffena turns and gives Shughart and Gordon the thumbs up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Visible through the windscreen, Durant looks up at the De snipers in the chopper above and sees Goffena's Black Haw fly off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McKnight's convoy rolls through a hail of gun fire. INT. MCKNIGHT'S HUMVEE - CONT. McKnight shakes his head as casings rain down on him from the gun turret above.

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
dialogues.text: Mother fucker, mother fucker! The Humvee takes fire from all sides. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shaft of light tears through the door and into Othic's shoulder. A round hits Othic in the knee. He screams and then sees an RPG coming straight at the driver's door.

dialogues.speaker: RPG
dialogues.text: The RPG comes crashing through the metal -- but doesn't explode. The convoy stops. McKnight walks to Alphabet's truck and yanks the door ope Dazed, Othic looks to Kowalewski: there's a foot long RPG missile embedded in his chest, fins sticking out his left side, arm severed off. Kowalewski is dead.

dialogues.speaker: OTHIC
dialogues.text: There's a fucking bomb in him, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
dialogues.text: Othic, calm down, god dammit! That's live ammo! Now get out! Othic jumps out of the Humvee. McKnight gets Kowalewski o of the truck.

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
dialogues.text: Come on, let's move him. Son of a bitch! The men lift the dead Kowalewski to a Humvee.

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
dialogues.text: All right, lift him up, lift him up. Easy, easy, all right, get him in there. Good, good, easy, easy! Othic tries to climb into the Humvee as well as the men gingerly load Kowalewski in to the back.

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
dialogues.text: Get back in that truck and drive.

dialogues.speaker: OTHIC
dialogues.text: I'm shot, Colonel.

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
dialogues.text: Everybody's shot. We need the prisoners. Let's go!  83.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A voice crackles through the radio.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO VOICE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: C3 says to take Halwadig and take it straight.

dialogues.speaker: HARRELL
dialogues.text: McKnight, we need you to turn around and head back to Halwadig. INTERCUT to McKnight - radios back --

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
dialogues.text: You're shitting me. We just came through there. There's gotta be a better way!

dialogues.speaker: HARRELL
dialogues.text: That's the info I'm getting from JOC. You need to turn around and head back. McKnight looks at Maddox. Shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
dialogues.text: Roger that, roger that. I cannot believe this shit. (sighs) Turn us around, Maddox.

dialogues.speaker: MADDOX
dialogues.text: They're trying to get us fucking killed, aren't they, Sir?

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
dialogues.text: Just get it over with. Drive!

dialogues.speaker: MADDOX
dialogues.text: God damn!

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
dialogues.text: Just, just get us outta here, god dammit! Drive! Resigned, Maddox executes a K-turn. The column slowly tur around. Maddox hits the gas. They head right back into the fray. Hell begins anew. HUNDREDS of rounds RAKE the vehicles, punching holes through metal. The windshield SHATTERS, spraying glass into Maddox's fac (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MADDOX
dialogues.text: AHHH! I'm blind. (grabs the wheel) Keep your foot on the gas! A bullet PINGS into the doorframe next to McKnight, slice into his neck. Blood sprays the dashboard.

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
dialogues.text: Fuck! He presses a hand on his wound. Maddox's face is a mass of blood, hands to his eyes. But keeps stepping on the pedal, McKnight steering, neck blee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still strapped to his seat Durant sees the Black Hawk fly overhead. Hears Somali voices, yelling, coming closer. Tries to rea back for his rifle, grunts in agony, back damaged. Can't to it. Sweating, reaching, swearing in pain as -- SOMALI FACES appear in his windscreen, raise their AKs at him. D raises one arm to protect himself as he fires -- the firs Somali gunmen's chest EXPLODES. Gordon and Shughart land. GUNFIRE raging as they charge t the chopper. DURANT - Somalis charge the Black Hawk. Durant fires away He sees Shughart and Gordon rounding the corner, boots slapping earth. Appearing like angels. They fire at the approaching Somalis. Shughart bangs on the Black Hawk.

dialogues.speaker: SHUGHART
dialogues.text: Friendlies! Shughart checks Frank's pulse.

dialogues.speaker: DURANT
dialogues.text: God, it's good to see!

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: Oh, it's good to see you. How bad?

dialogues.speaker: DURANT
dialogues.text: My leg's broken. My back feels kinda weird. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: We gotta get you outta here, buddy. I'm pulling him out. Cover! Gordon gently lifts Durant from the chopper and he scream in pain. Shughart covers.

dialogues.speaker: SHUGHART
dialogues.text: I'm gonna put you down. They prop him against a wall.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: Cross, we're at the Six Four crash sight, securing the perimeter. You all right?

dialogues.speaker: DURANT
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm good. Shughart puts Durant's MP-5 in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: You're locked and loaded. If you see anyone come around these corners -- you watch your back. Shughart and Gordon run back to the crash site.

dialogues.speaker: DURANT
dialogues.text: Hey! Where's the rescue squad?

dialogues.speaker: SHUGHART
dialogues.text: We're it! Durant is left alone, cradling his MP-5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steele talks to Harrell on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: STEELE
dialogues.text: C2, you keep talking about a convoy, I would dearly like to know where in sam hill that is, over?

dialogues.speaker: HARRELL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Perimeter has to be tighter for the convoy. You're too far from the crash. They spread out like that, and you're all liable to be overrun. Over. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: STEELE
dialogues.text: C2, if I use two men for each wounded, I still got nobody left to shoot. Now, we're staying where we are, over? Ruiz sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the lead Humvee of the Lost Convoy, Maddox mops at his bloodied face while McKnight, peering out the broken windshield, drives, his neck a mess of blood... McKnight finds himself in front of a familiar building -- the target building.

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
dialogues.text: Stop, stop, stop, stop, stop, Maddox, stop! INT. MCKNIGHT'S HUMVEE - CONT. Maddox face is a bloody mess. He slams on the brakes.

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
dialogues.text: (resigned, into radio) Son of a bitch! Romeo Six Four we're right back where we started! I'm running low on ammo. I got many wounded, including me. Vehicles that are barely running.

dialogues.speaker: HARRELL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Okay, Danny, I need a no bcs. assessment here. Can you get to the crash site? McKnight hears groans of the wounded in back, sounds of t rims grinding on the road, bullets smacking into metal.

dialogues.speaker: MADDOX
dialogues.text: Colonel, I can't see shit.

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
dialogues.text: Negative. With the amount of wounded we have, we'd do more harm than good. We need to come back to base, rearm and regroup and then we can go back out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monitoring this, Garrison speaks into a headset.

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: C2...bring 'em back. Get 'em out of there!

dialogues.speaker: HARRELL
dialogues.text: Roger, return to base. INT. MCKNIGHT'S HUMVEE - CONT. McKnight shouts to the wounded men in back.

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
dialogues.text: We're going home. Let's go! Left! Go, go, go, go, god dammit! Run that mother fucker over! Go, go, go! Left, left, left, left, left! We're gonna be home in a second, we're gonna be home in a second. Hang on! God dammit, you guys hang on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Galentine throws his radio headset down.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: What's up?

dialogues.speaker: GALENTINE
dialogues.text: They're sending 'em back. The convoy's headed back to base camp. Some of the other men hear it and look over to Eversmann. What now? What does he suggest now?

dialogues.speaker: WADDELL
dialogues.text: Oh, now that makes sense, don't it? We need to exfil the wounded now, and get the hell outta here before its too late!

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: If Colonel McKnight went back to base, then he had a damn good reason. It changes nothing. Right now, some of his men don't seem too convinced. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: All right, listen up. We're gonna hold the perimeter. We're gonna hold the strongpoint. Hooah! Eversmann looks at each man, into the wide, scared eyes o Smith, Galentine, Kurth, Goodale, Waddell and Doc Schmid.

dialogues.speaker: MEN
dialogues.text: (in unison) Hooah!

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Conserve your ammo. Only shoot at what you can hit. Hooah?

dialogues.speaker: MEN
dialogues.text: (in unison) Hooah! His men stare out into the city, gripping weapons. Fear turning to anger, confusion into focus.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: The convoy's gonna come. We're gonna get home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delta snipers GORDON AND SHUGHART are sprawled out under ruined chopper tail, ammo magazines piled beside them. THEY FIRE at endless targets. Countless AK-47 muzzle flas flare from every direction. A living nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: Loading. Gordon slaps in an ammo mag, Shughart covering them. GORDON'S POV - firing again, he hits EVERYTHING. Militia nailed in the head, chest, some targets 100 yeards away.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: Randy, I need a pistol mag! Shughart throws Gordon the mag and he loads it.

dialogues.speaker: SHUGHART
dialogues.text: Loading. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 205 206 207 GORDON FIRES AT MILITIA. OVERHEAD - THOUSANDS OF SOMALIS edge closer to them -- an armed, furious mob that will stop at nothing. Shughart grabs a magazine.

dialogues.speaker: SHUGHART
dialogues.text: Loading. Gordon grabs a magazine. Pile of ammo getting smaller. ON THE PILE OF MAGAZINES - Gordon reaches for the last on

dialogues.speaker: GORDON
dialogues.text: Randy, last mag! Crowd of Somalis now charging at them, making suicide run Too many of them. Gordon takes a bullet in the head.

dialogues.speaker: SHUGHART
dialogues.text: Gordy! Shughart runs in to Gordon.

dialogues.speaker: SHUGHART
dialogues.text: Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Durant is firing his MP-5 at dozens of Somalis. Every tim he fires they disappear behind walls. Shughart scrambles back to Durant, gives him a CAR-15 rifle. The weapon is covered in blood. Gordon's. Shughart touches Durant's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: SHUGHART
dialogues.text: Good luck. Shughart again crawls under the chopper as -- SOMALIS pee around the corner. Durant fires at them. Two more gunmen poke their heads around. Durant fires again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hundreds of Somalis race towards the crash site.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garrison speaks to Cribbs in the subdued JOC. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: We need the 10th Mountain in there. Everything they got. Pakistanis, Malays, I want their tanks and APCs. On the monitors, Garrison can see roadblocks going up in streets surrounding Wolcott's crash, boxing the Americans in.

dialogues.speaker: CRIBBS
dialogues.text: They still don't know we've gone in.

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: Look. We have stirred up the hornet's nest here. We're fighting the entire city. I want every vehicle possible. If it has four wheels and armor, get it! Get everything. Garrison and Cribbs consult a map of Mogadishu, hostile a safe areas outlined in red and green.

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: Now once they've assembled, we need to move our men out of the hostile area and back to The Pakistani stadium, the safe zone. Now let's go!

dialogues.speaker: CRIBBS
dialogues.text: (Cribbs nods -- sounds good) Roger that, boss. Cribbs leaves the room. INT. DURANT'S BLACK HAWK - CONT. SOUNDS OF a FRANTIC FUSILLADE echoes from the other side the chopper. Shughart's gun roaring. AK-47s firing back. The SOMALIS charge toward Shughart. Fires a quick burst. Somalis fall dead as -- Shughart takes several bullets at close range. SOUNDS of the fusillade on the other side of the chopper continue. Then...the shooting stops. A strange dutty spotping. then hundreds of Somalis swarm from either side of the helicopter. EXT. DURANT'S CRASH SITE - CONT. A SOMALI pops his head around the corner. Durant fires, dropping him. Click! The weapon goes dry as Durant runs o of ammo. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 208 209 The crowd drags the wounded crew from the chopper, tearin off clothes, boots. Durant has time to do one last thing: pulls a snapshot of his wife and infant child from his flight suit pocket. Somalis finally see him in the corner. They descend upon him. A rifle butt slams into Durant's face, breaking his nose the orbital bone of his left eye. He's kicked, spit on, uniform ripped at, crowd trying to pull him apart. The photo of his family falls from his grasp. In a haze o pain, he crawls after the snapshot. A boot stomps on his hand, photo kicked away. KRATAKRATAT! Gunfire erupts over the crowd's head. Everyt stops as MO'ALIM hops down from a technical skidding to a halt, .50 caliber smoking. A big Somali with him, FIRIMBI, shouts into a megaphone;

dialogues.speaker: FIRIMBI
dialogues.text: (in Somali, subtitled) Back up! Mohamed Farrah Aidid claims this prisoner alive. Durant opens his eyes, sees Mo'Alim's elaborate tattoos, teeth stained orange and black from khat. As Firimbi agai shouts into the megaphone, Mo'Alim fires his AK-47 over t crowd's head. Somalis retreat as Durant passes out again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McKnight's convoy arrives, battered and bloody. McKnight watches his men, many of them injured themselves unload the wounded and dead. Wex is dead. Joyce. Several others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Struecker's convoy keeps moving but is making little prog roadblocks everywhere, constant volleys of gunfire.

dialogues.speaker: HARRELL, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: See where those tires are burning? All that black smoke? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: STRUECKER
dialogues.text: Roger, I can see it, but I can't get there. Over. They can see the smoke in the sky, but all the streets le there are strategically blocked.

dialogues.speaker: HARRELL
dialogues.text: Go a hundred meters past it, that's the crash.

dialogues.speaker: STRUECKER
dialogues.text: Negative. You don't understand, it's roadblock after roadblock. You have to find us another route. Over.

dialogues.speaker: HARRELL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: There ain't one. The only other route is all the way around the city.

dialogues.speaker: STRUECKER
dialogues.text: Roger that, we'll take it.

dialogues.speaker: HOOT
dialogues.text: (grabs the radio handset) Kilo Six Four, this is Kilo One One, request permission to move to crash Site number 2 on foot. Over. As Hoot reloads and waits for an okay, Struecker regards like he's nuts. To Struecker --

dialogues.speaker: HARRELL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Green light, Kilo One. Green light.

dialogues.speaker: HOOT
dialogues.text: Stop the vehicle. Let me out. Struecker slows. Hoot jumps out. Raps on the side of the Humvee for a couple of other Delta to join him, including Sizemore. The four run down a side street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The voice comes from a loudspeaker mounted on the mosque. unseen holy man intoning the evening prayer -  213 214 215 216 93.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eversmann hears the lone voice, too. Then other voices jo in from mosque loudspeakers elsewhere in the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steele and his men listen to it in their stable. Wilkinson adjusts the drip on an IV bag. Fluids slowly dr into the crew chief's veins. Tries to relax the other daz crew chief as he works:

dialogues.speaker: WILKINSON
dialogues.text: After I'm finished with this, I'll whip you_boys up some margaritas. The usual, blended, no salt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eversmann's group listens to the evening prayer.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO VOICE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: pomebody's always gotta ruin a party, uh?

dialogues.speaker: KURTH
dialogues.text: (in Somali) Meat pa pa. Smith throws Kurth his canteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the voices echo, Sanderson and his group keep moving through narrow slum streets. He radios Eversmann --

dialogues.speaker: SANDERSON
dialogues.text: Eversmann, come in. Eversmann. INTERCUT - with Eversmann, his chalk in strategic positio outside his Alamo building.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Roger. Who is this?

dialogues.speaker: SANDERSON
dialogues.text: Sanderson. Do not, I say again, do not fire to the east. We are coming to you.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: (into radio) Understood. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Di Tomasso and his men are on the southeast corner. We need you on the northeast building.

dialogues.speaker: SANDERSON
dialogues.text: Roger, we'll take it.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Hey, watch out for skinnies. They're all over the rooftops. Sanderson motions for his men to move forward. Eversmann turns to his men --

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: (quietly) Hold your fire to the east! Sanderson's men move towards the northeast building. Grim bringing up the rear.

dialogues.speaker: SANDERSON
dialogues.text: Follow him! Go, go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twombly, Nelson and Yurek are sixty yards and across the street from Eversmann's position. They dash out, the hulk shape of Wolcott's Black Hawk visible in the intersection

dialogues.speaker: YUREK
dialogues.text: Eversmann. It's Yurek, I got, I got Nelson and Twombly with me. We got the chopper in sight. Where are you? INTERCUT - with Eversmann.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: We're on the Southwest corner. Where the hell have you been? Are you okay? Nelson takes ammo from a dead Somali lying at their feet.

dialogues.speaker: YUREK
dialogues.text: Yeah. Hold your fire. We're coming in.

dialogues.speaker: YUREK
dialogues.text: We gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: TWOMBLY
dialogues.text: (shouting) Shawn, Shawn, listen. Sergeant Yurek's gonna run first. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TWOMBLY
dialogues.text: (Yurek's look says, I am?) Now when he gets across the street, he's gonna turn around and he's gonna cover you as you run. Listen closely - when you get there, you're gonna turn around and you're gonna cover me. Okay? Nelson nods, but Twombly isn't really sure he understands

dialogues.speaker: TWOMBLY
dialogues.text: Now you're not just gonna run to Eversmann's position, you're going to stop. You're gonna turn around and you are gonna cover me. It's important you understand that. Nelson nods again, but it's even less convincing this tim Twombly glances to Yurek.

dialogues.speaker: TWOMBLY
dialogues.text: Okay, you ready?

dialogues.speaker: YUREK
dialogues.text: Yeah, I guess. Yurek RUNS right through the center of the street. BACK ON NELSON - getting ready --

dialogues.speaker: TWOMBLY
dialogues.text: Hey, hey! Don't forget.

dialogues.speaker: NELSON
dialogues.text: (shouting) What?

dialogues.speaker: TWOMBLY
dialogues.text: Don't forget. Nelson can't hear him. Twombly shrugs, Oh, fuck it, go. N runs. He makes it across the street, turns, sets and cove Twombly's run perfectly. ON EVERSMANN - he, Smith, Kurth, Goodale, Galentine and Waddell watch as Yurek hauls ass.

dialogues.speaker: GALENTINE
dialogues.text: I got them in my sights, Sarge. They're coming up on the west gate. I see 'em.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Let's move out. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: YUREK
dialogues.text: You gonna cover us Sergeant? Eversmann radios back.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: We got ya. Yurek makes it across to them, turns, sets to cover Nelso

dialogues.speaker: TWOMBLY
dialogues.text: Nelson. PROVIDING COVER - as Nelson runs across. Eversmann sees Somali's aiming but it's too late to warn Twombly, who charges across the courtyard.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Fuck! WHUMP! a Somali bullet hits Twombly in the back, right on the bandolier of SAW bullets wrapped around him. Three SA rounds explode, lighting Twombly up like a human firecrac SMITH charges into the swarm of Somali gunfire, out into street to get Twombly --

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Twombly!

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Smith, no! Smith yanks Twombly to his feet and pulls him along, almo to Eversmann before -- bullets trace a path up the street round SMACKING into Smith's thigh, blood spraying the str Smith goes down.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Oh, God, I'm hit! Eversmann runs past the stumbling Twombly, ducks gunfire he grabs Smith, drags him the rest of the way and -- INT. - ALAMO HOUSE - CONT. Inside, where they carry him to a table.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: One, two, three. You're all right, you're all right. You're all right. All right? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Doc Schmid immediately gets to work. Smith moans in pain.

dialogues.speaker: SCHMID
dialogues.text: I need pressure on this wound. Pressure, okay? We're gonna need more Cur Lex gauze. I need more men in here.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Twombly! Nelson.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Oh man, that really, that really hurts!

dialogues.speaker: SCHMID
dialogues.text: I need that chair, that chair! Pressure, get that pressure on it. Okay, let me have a look, let me have a look. All right, all right. Let me get a look at that. Rips Smith's pant leg, is spurted with arterial spray. Bl through it to get his kit open. Stuffs Curlex gauze into Smith"s gaping wound.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Oh, oh, what the fuck is that? Eversmann presses it into the wound but it's like trying cover a fire hose with a mattress. Schmid shoves more Cur at Eversmann as he readies an IV.

dialogues.speaker: SCHMID
dialogues.text: Hold that down. I need a medivac now.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Galentine! Galentine, get me Captain Steele!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steele kneels down to check on Ruiz.

dialogues.speaker: STEELE
dialogues.text: Sergeant, sergeant Ruiz, how're you doing? Ruiz is spitting up blood.

dialogues.speaker: RUIZ
dialogues.text: They're not gonna come and get us. They're not gonna come for us. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: STEELE
dialogues.text: I need you to suck it up Sergeant. I need you to focus for me. All right, can you do that? Now, can you hold your weapon?

dialogues.speaker: RUIZ
dialogues.text: Yes sir.

dialogues.speaker: STEELE
dialogues.text: If anybody comes through that door, you give â€˜em two in the chest and one in the head. Steele hands Ruiz his weapon.

dialogues.speaker: STEELE
dialogues.text: You understand?

dialogues.speaker: RUIZ
dialogues.text: I'm still willing to fight, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Captain Steele, Captain Steele, INTERCUT - with Eversmann.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: I need a medivac in here now. Corporal Smith's been hit.

dialogues.speaker: STEELE
dialogues.text: Hold on Two Five.

dialogues.speaker: RUIZ
dialogues.text: Still willing to fight.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Captain Steele, he's hurt pretty bad.

dialogues.speaker: STEELE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Ah, Two Five, we got wounded too. You're just gonna have to maintain your situation, over? Smith yells in agony.

dialogues.speaker: SCHMID
dialogues.text: If he doesn't get to a hospital ina half-hour, he's in trouble. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: STEELE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: C-2, this is Six Four. I'm requesting an immediate medical medivac for a critically wounded at Chalk Four's location, over.

dialogues.speaker: HARRELL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Command Chalk Four is requesting medivac.

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: ye can't risk it. It's still too ot.

dialogues.speaker: HARRELL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Captain, we can not send in medivac at this time. Sit tight, over.

dialogues.speaker: STEELE
dialogues.text: Two Five, this is Six Four. It's a negative on the medivac. It's not ossible. JOC can not risk another ird. You're just gonna have to hold on. Six One out. Long silence. Eversmann puts the radio back as Smith writ in pain.

dialogues.speaker: SCHMID
dialogues.text: Put pressure on the wound.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Yeah. It's gonna be all right, it's gonna be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoot, Sizemore and the Delta men move almost silently, we NODS through the narrow alleyways. Up ahead they see Durant's downed Black Hawk, figures swa over it, dragging off equipment. Hoot comes charging up, firing over their heads:

dialogues.speaker: HOOT
dialogues.text: (in Somali, subtitled) I think this is mine! The crowd bolts out of the Black Hawk and down the street  222 223 100.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No crew inside. Everything that can be ripped from the co panel is gone. Hoot sees Gordon's plastic pro-tech helmet, neat hole in forehead. Hoot picks it up and holds it for a moment, the sets it on the console. Stares up at the men, eyes speaki volumes. They run from the wreckage and trigger a thermite charge the Black Hawk. As they run away, Super Six-Four EXPLODES thermite charge lighting up the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The explosion flares on a screen. Garrison and others kno what it means. Their heads aren't bowed, but the atmosphe in the room is like a funereal. A soldier hands Garrison radio.

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: Cribbs?

dialogues.speaker: CRIBBS
dialogues.text: Sir, they're still debating the route.

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: How long?

dialogues.speaker: CRIBBS
dialogues.text: At least a couple of hours.

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: We haven't got that long, Joe. The rescue convoy is assembling within an enormous soccer stadium. Pakistani tanks pass Cribbs, who is on the phone his Little Bird flies over behind him.

dialogues.speaker: CRIBBS
dialogues.text: Pakistani General said since we didn't deem to inform him of the raid, he's gonna take as much time as he wants. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: (rubs his forehead) Well you tell the General this: I understand. But it is my duty to remind him that my men are_surrounded by thousands of armed Somali militia. It is imperative that we move them out of the hostile area and into the safe zone. I need his help, now.

dialogues.speaker: CRIBBS
dialogues.text: Yes sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Durant comes to in a room, tying on a paper-thin mattress back propped against the wall. Sees Firimbi, the man from the crash site with the megaphone, stepping forward. He h Durant's dog tags.

dialogues.speaker: FIRIMBI
dialogues.text: Durant. Michael Durant.

dialogues.speaker: DURANT
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: FIRIMBI
dialogues.text: You are the Ranger who kills my people? Durant shakes his head no.

dialogues.speaker: DURANT
dialogues.text: I'm not a Ranger. I'ma pilot. Firimbi offers Durant a cigarette. Durant shakes his head

dialogues.speaker: FIRIMBI
dialogues.text: Huh. That's right. None of you Americans smoke anymore. You all live long, dull, uninteresting lives. Durant tries to move, winces in pain.

dialogues.speaker: DURANT
dialogues.text: What do you want with me?

dialogues.speaker: FIRIMBI
dialogues.text: You have taken hostages. We have you.

dialogues.speaker: DURAN
dialogues.text: My government will never negotiate for me. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FIRIMBI
dialogues.text: (smiles) Then perhaps, you and I can negotiate. Huh? Soldier to soldier...hmm? Firimbi offers Durant a drink. Durant shakes his head no.

dialogues.speaker: DURANT
dialogues.text: I'm not in charge.

dialogues.speaker: FIRIMBI
dialogues.text: Course not, you have the power to. kill, but not negotiate. In Somalia killing is negotiation. Do you really think if you get General Aidid, we will simply put_down our weapons and adopt American Democracy? That the killing will stop? We know this: without victory there can be no peace. There will always be killing, you see? This is how things are in our world. Firimbi tosses Durant his tags and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Black Hawk flies over the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eversmann watches Schmid work on Smith.

dialogues.speaker: SCHMID
dialogues.text: You gotta take over for me. Both hands. Schmid pulls Eversmann aside.

dialogues.speaker: SCHMID
dialogues.text: It's the femora artery. I can't see it. Which means that it's retracted up into the pelvis. Which means that I have_to find it and clamp it. It's the only way to stop the bleeding... I got no more IV's. So, I'm gonna need you to assist. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE - on a pair of medical clamps. Eversmann holds the clamps, he and Doc Schmid kneeling beside Smith. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SCHMID
dialogues.text: Now listen Jamie, I've gotta do something, it's going to hurt. Okay? I gotta cause you more pain, but I have to do it to help you. All right? You understand?

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Give me some morphine.

dialogues.speaker: SCHMID
dialogues.text: I can't. It'll lower your heart rate too far. I'm sorry. Here Twombly, why don't you take his hands there. He's already hooked up to two IV bags, needles in both ar

dialogues.speaker: SCHMID
dialogues.text: I need you to hold the wound open, keep pressure on the top of the leg. Yurek, you're gonna take the feet and the flashlight. On my count. All right, Jamie. All right man. Schmid looks at Eversmann to ask, ready? Eversmann nods.

dialogues.speaker: SCHMID
dialogues.text: One, two, three. Schmid pulls out the Curlex, releasing the blood flow, th sticks both hands into the wound and probes for the arter Smith wails. Schmid probes around until --

dialogues.speaker: SCHMID
dialogues.text: Wait, wait, wait. Okay. I feel it. I feel the pulse.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: SCHMID
dialogues.text: I got it, I got it, I got it, yeah, I got it. I got it, I got it.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: You got it? You need these?

dialogues.speaker: SCHMID
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah. Clamp.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Yeah, I got it clamped, I got it clamped. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SCHMID
dialogues.text: You got it? You got it? Hold it.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Here, grab it. It's tearing. Schmid putts the siippery artery into _the open. Eversman e holds t clamp out, but the artery slithers away with a snap.

dialogues.speaker: SCHMID
dialogues.text: Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: It's going back in, it's going back in, it's tearing!

dialogues.speaker: SCHMID
dialogues.text: Hold it! Fuck, okay get out, get out!

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: SCHMID
dialogues.text: Hold the wound.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Okay, okay, I'm holding.

dialogues.speaker: SCHMID
dialogues.text: Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: SCHMID
dialogues.text: Move your hand.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Yeah. Schmid's hands disappear into the wound again. Gets the clamp ready, but Schmid can't locate the artery, shaking his head in frustration.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: What? Smith_is passing out. Schmid has to give up the search be he kills him. His bloody hands come out without the arter Angry at himself, he stuffs new Curlex into the wound. Sm eyes slit open as he weakly manages:

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: You fix it? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The unused clamp is still in Eversmann's hand.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Yeah, man. We got it. Smith nods, eyes closing, passing out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grimes is grinding coffee beans.

dialogues.speaker: SANDERSON
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: GRIMES
dialogues.text: It's all in the grind, Sarge. Can't be too fine, can't be too coarse. Grimsey, you are squared away. Grimes pours a cup of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mo'Alim watches his men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grimes limps over to Sanderson who is sitting on a ratty couch.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMES
dialogues.text: Sarge, how'd you like a nice hot cup of Joe? Gold coast blend.

dialogues.speaker: SANDERSON
dialogues.text: Sit down. Let me take a look at that foot.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMES
dialogues.text: Oh no, it's not a problem.

dialogues.speaker: SANDERSON
dialogues.text: Come on, come on, come on. But Sanderson is already kneeling in front of him, cuttin off the laces Grimes's right boot. Sanderson finishes cutting, slips the boot off to reveal a golfball-sized piece of shrapnel sticking out of his fo

dialogues.speaker: SANDERSON
dialogues.text: Oh. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GRIMES
dialogues.text: Oh my God. I don't even feel that.

dialogues.speaker: SANDERSON
dialogues.text: It cauterized on impact. (wraps gauze around it) If this thing starts to smart, you let me know, all right? Where the hell'd they find you?

dialogues.speaker: GRIMES
dialogues.text: Behind a desk. Sanderson laughs.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMES
dialogues.text: No, really. You think I'm kidding? BA-WHOOM! A blast shakes the house, walls rocking.

dialogues.speaker: SANDERSON
dialogues.text: Anybody hit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mo'Alim shouts at a militia man, who adjusts the angle an drops another missile in -- PHWOMP it shoots skyward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone hits the deck as the round whistles in. This tim the house is rocked nearly off its foundation. Part of a wall collapses. Doc Schmid covers Smith with his body.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: You all right? Is everybody all right? Schmid nods his head yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEYOND THE MASSIVE CITY ARCHWAY, Mo'Alim is wearing Russi made Night Vision goggles. He directs two technicals with mortars on back, instructing his men to change angles and fire again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The walls shake as another round comes in. Eversmann runs forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mo'Alim fires an automatic weapon.

dialogues.speaker: MO'ALIM
dialogues.text: (in Somali, subtitled) Keep firing....faster!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoot, Sizemore and one other Delta man move slowly, silen through the night, NODS on their heads. The sound of stac gunfire grows louder as they near Crash Site One. A RUMBLE - and Hoot motions with hand signals. They creep forward down the block, guns raised, NODs over their eyes They fire again -- and commandeer an RPG gun. Mo'Alim looks around, as -- CRACK!CRACK! Two more militia drop to the ground. He sees Hoot load a mortar and fire i directly at him. Mo'Alim's head rocks backwards. He is dead. Hoot, Sizemore and two Deltas run forward down the street

dialogues.speaker: HOOT
dialogues.text: Ranger here. This is Kilo One One.

dialogues.speaker: GALENTINE
dialogues.text: This is Chalk Four, we're at the Southeast corner of crash site. Who is this over?

dialogues.speaker: HOOT
dialogues.text: We're coming in with three friendlies. I need some covering fire, over. GALENTINE - passes the word along, trying not to shout:

dialogues.speaker: GALENTINE
dialogues.text: Roger that Kilo One One. Hold your fire! Deltas coming in.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIERS
dialogues.text: (in unison) Hold your fire! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ON HOOT - down the block, Sizemore and Delta behind, the group moving in a rapid crouch, blending with shadows. Rapid footsteps. Then the Rangers and the Delta Operators appearing in the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garrison looks at the screens. Says to a man behind him:

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: Ground personnel will have to mark target positions with infrared strobes. Get Little Birds on strafing runs and keep â€œem going all night long. (stares at the monitors) If we don't hold back this city, we'll have a hundred caskets to fill by morning.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR
dialogues.text: Yes sir. Colonel Harrell, ground ersonnel at Crash Site One will ave to mark the target with infrared strobes in preparation for air strike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the complex logistics of organizing the vehicle Rescue Convoy continues -- McKnight, Struecker, Othic, and a group of Delta Operator arrive in Jeeps; Ali are blood spattered or wounded from ride through hell in the Humvee convoys. Cribbs approaches as they climb out of the jeeps. Even Th who didn't want to go before, is with them.

dialogues.speaker: CRIBBS
dialogues.text: McKnight! Between the tenth Mountain and U.N., we got enough personnel, okay! Danny, you guys do not have to go back out again. McKnight looks at Cribbs.

dialogues.speaker: CRIBBS
dialogues.text: All right, come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Rescue Convoy, finally, is about to leave. Humvees, trucks, tanks, and APCs. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The tank treads grind and begin moving out, followed by t rest of the trucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been some time now.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: I can't die here man.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: You're not gonna die, all right? You're not gonna die. Eversmann is kneeling next to Doc Schmid and Smith. Eversmann is watching Smith, pale white, eyes glazed.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: You don't have anything to be sorry for. You saved Twombly. You did perfect.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: (eyes move to Twombly) You okay, Twombs? womb ly has wandered over, stares down at Smith. Doesn't know what to say. Eversmann looks from Twombly to Smith.

dialogues.speaker: TWOMBLY
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm okay, Jamie. Now the whole room is watching as Smith begins hyper - ventilating a sickening wheezing sound echoing off the st walls. Smith's eyes start to dart around the room.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: You did what you were trained to do. You should be proud of that. Be proud of that. Smith nods, teeth chattering.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Ev? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Do me a favor.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: You tell my parents, that I fought well today. That I... that I... that I fought hard.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: You're gonna tell â€˜em yourself, okay? You hear me? Smith is shaking uncontrollably.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: All right?

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Are the Humvees here?

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: They're coming, Jamie.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: They're coming.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: You just gotta hang in there a little bit. You gotta hold out for justa little bit, you can do that.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: I can. (gasping for breath) I can do it. This is nothin'.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: This is nothin'. It's nothin'.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: This is nothin'.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: It's nothin'.

dialogues.speaker: SMITH
dialogues.text: Okay. Nothin'. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Smith grips Eversmann's bloodstained hand. Eversmann nods

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: This is nothinâ€™... Smith's eyes begin to change... a certainty comes into th Now he stares somewhere beyond the ceiling - Schmid runs forward.

dialogues.speaker: SCHMID
dialogues.text: Oh shit! Hold the wound! The Alamo house is silent, everyone watching as Schmid administers CPR. Compresses Smith's chest again and again After a long time, Eversmann reaches out, stops Schmid. Doc sits back, covered in blood. Stares down at Smith, resigned.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Oh, God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slumped against a crumbling wall in the silent house, Eversmann stares at Smith's body, covered by a tattered blanket in the center of the room. Hoot moves to the body, finds Smith's CAR-15 on the groun blood-spattered. Hoot picks it up, takes out the magazine

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Hoot doesn't look up as he clicks the rounds out one by o

dialogues.speaker: HOOT
dialogues.text: We need the ammo. Eversmann watches the Delta soldier pick up the extra rou

dialogues.speaker: HOOT
dialogues.text: You did all you could here. Eversmann's gaze again falls to Smith's form under the blanket.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: They should've sent a medivac. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HOOT
dialogues.text: Well, right now we'd be out there defending another crashed chopper. More men would get torn up.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Maybe... Hoot walks over to the wall next to Eversmann.

dialogues.speaker: HOOT
dialogues.text: So you're thinking. Don't. (beat) Cause Sergeant, you can't control who gets hit, or who doesn't. who falls out of a chopper, or why. It ain't up to you. It's just war.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: (nods, he knows, but) Smith is still dead. If Blackburn wouldn't fallen none of this woulda happened --

dialogues.speaker: HOOT
dialogues.text: (stares at him) Listen -- should have_or could have -- it don't matter; You'll get plenty of_time to think about all that later. Believe me. Hoot looks at Eversmann.

dialogues.speaker: HOOT
dialogues.text: Sergeant. You got your men this far. You did it right today... (Eversmann glances up at him) You need to start thinking about getting these men out of he Hoot looks up.

dialogues.speaker: HOOT
dialogues.text: Well, shall we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gunfire erupts around them. The men rush out to defend th position.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: I need four guns on this corner, now!  245 246 247 248 113.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Wood brings the Little Bird in low, there are suddenly countless dots of light surrounding the entire perimeter the area, from the streets and rooftops ringing the court yard -- all firing at him. He sees THOUSANDS of glowing Somali bodies, ghostly, innumerable on his infra -- red monitor. ADJOINING ROOFTOPS - more than two-hundred beat signature of Somali bodies charge across rooftops, coming toward th chalks in a great wave, leaping from roof to roof. OPPOSITE SIDE OF THE STREET - three hundred Somalis move get in position to fire down at the chalks. Somalis climb staircases, ladders, appearing on rooftops like angry ins

dialogues.speaker: WOOD
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ! Look at that. Wood pilots a nimble Little Bird over the crash site. See nothing but dark forms around buildings and a blur of wre metal below as he shrieks past.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: This is Two Five. I can see you, you're right above me.

dialogues.speaker: WOOD
dialogues.text: Eversmann, I can't tell who's who down there. Too much activity. INT. JOINT OPERATIONS CENTER - CONT. ON A MONITOR - infrared figures of Rangers hiding in buil around the crash site illuminate the video screens: white blobs, like something out of a low -- tech video game.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: I'll mark the target with a strobe, over?

dialogues.speaker: WOOD
dialogues.text: Roger that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eversmann throws a strobe. It does not fire.  249 250 251 252 114.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wood looks for the strobe to flash.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: See it?

dialogues.speaker: WOOD
dialogues.text: Nah, I can't see shit.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Eversmann is at the radio, Galentine shaking his bead, no

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: I'm puttin' it on the roof. Eversmann begins gathering the IR strobes. Hoot says:

dialogues.speaker: HOOT
dialogues.text: You're gonna need some help.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Cover me.

dialogues.speaker: HOOT
dialogues.text: Okay guys, we're gonna lay down some cover fire for him on three. Ready? One, two, three, go! His chalk finishes reloading and sets to cover him. He lo at them. Ready? Is he? Yes. Whup-whup-whup -- Wood's Litt Bird howls overhead. Somalis FIRING as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Eversmann sprints from the Somali building into the shooting range of the street, bullets tracking him -- a hellstorm, Eversmann right in the middle of it. Eversmann tosses the strobe on the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wood sees the strobe flash through his NOD.

dialogues.speaker: WOOD
dialogues.text: I got your position, I got the target. We're inbound and hot. RPG explode outside the bird, lighting up the sky and roc the craft. Wood hits the trigger on the flight stick. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: His miniguns blaze strobelight-death across the rooftops. Somali heat signatures scatter under the withering fire o the swift chopper's deadly arsenal. EVERSMANN - Finished, prepares for the final run back to Alamo building. The street echoes with the roar of weapons as Eversmann l inside to safety. Figures fire their weapons down the block toward the cras site. The Little Birds turn to make another pass.

dialogues.speaker: WOOD
dialogues.text: Ya'll keep your heads down. We're coming back around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garrison watches the screen. Steele's voice comes in thro the radio.

dialogues.speaker: STEELE
dialogues.text: Six Two, this is Six Four. Where the hell's the convoy? Over.

dialogues.speaker: HARRELL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Half a block from your location, hang in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An RPG slams into the wall, rocking the building.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Shit! The Little Bird again shrieks past his building, miniguns rumbling. Bullets ZING over their heads, blasting walls inside the house. Somali fire increases, web tightening. Chalk Four returns fire, guns raging through the night. Thousands of muzzle flashes rain from rooftops, windows a doorways of the buildings across the street. Somali bulle SMACK! and CRACK! all around them.  257 258 259 116.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wood's voice comes over the command net.

dialogues.speaker: WOOD, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: C2, miniguns dry. Returning to base.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL MATTHEWS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Roger that. Second team inbound. Your station. On your location, four minutes. ON SCREEN - as the chopper passes, smoke rises from the c site.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE RESCUE CONVOY - rumbling down the block. .50 cals roa from atop Humvees. Somalis are blown back into buildings the dozen. The massive convoy reduces Somali positions into dust, en buildings crumbling like saltine crackers. Dark figures continue to fall. Somali muzzle flashes dissipate... Captain Steele steps from the stable doorway and shakes h with Colonel McKnight.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN STEELE
dialogues.text: Captain Steele here, Colonel!

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
dialogues.text: Get your men loaded up Captain. We're gettin' the hell outta here.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN STEELE
dialogues.text: Yes, sir! All right, let's go. Be careful with the wounded.

dialogues.speaker: STEELE
dialogues.text: Two Five, this is Six Four, the rescue column has arrived and will be at your location in about ten minutes. Prepare your men for exfil Sergeant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eversmann closes his eyes and nods.

dialogues.speaker: STEELE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Six Four out. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Yeah, Roger that, sir. Roger that!

dialogues.speaker: STEELE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: All right, let's move it!

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Ten minutes! The convoy's gonna be here in ten minutes! His Rangers breathe a collective sigh of relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kurth, Waddell, and Galentine are covering their position weapons aimed out the doorway and firing into the night.

dialogues.speaker: KURTH
dialogues.text: Eversmann, I'm out!

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: This is my last one!
Eversmann goes to the door and stares at the incredible s of the convoy, so long he can't see the end of it. He sho over his shoulder:

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: The convoy's here! Random gunfire that comes from Somali houses are met with the full wrath of the U.S. Mountain Division as -- Eversmann sees Meknight striding alongside the lead Humve ignoring random Somali gunfire as if it doesn't exist.

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
dialogues.text: Sergeant Eversmann?

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: Yes, sir! McKnight sees him in the darkness. Walks toward him, hand outstretched.

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
dialogues.text: Heard you guys needed a lift.

dialogues.speaker: EVERSMANN
dialogues.text: (can't help smiling) Yes, sir. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: And he shakes the Colonel's outstretched hand.

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
dialogues.text: Bring you wounded right over there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Ranger takes a saw and cuts through the metal of Wolcot Black Hawk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanderson watches Grimes hobble to the doorway and goes t assist.

dialogues.speaker: SANDERSON
dialogues.text: Hey, I got ya! Grimes smiles through the pain, hobbling on his bad foot toward the waiting APC.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMES
dialogues.text: It's okay. I wanna walk.

dialogues.speaker: SANDERSON
dialogues.text: (lets Grimes go) You sure? Go! Sanderson watches Grimes run into the APC under his own p

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The saws are still at work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eversmann and Doc Schmid carry Smith's body, covered with sheet, out into the night. Load it into an APC. Hoot cove them, watching the rooftops, windows. Ever vigilant.

dialogues.speaker: RANGER
dialogues.text: I got him. One, two, three. Wilkinson and Fales are helped by dozens of Rangers as th carefully pass the wounded Warren and Dowdy out of the ru helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cribbs speaks to the Pakistani drivers. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CRIBBS
dialogues.text: Get the pilots' bodies out, then we go to the stadium. Behind Cribbs, soldiers load the many wounded and dead in vehicles. Groaning men are piled onto one another in the cramped APCs. Humvees are packed full. NEAR THE FOUNTAIN: Cribbs walks up to McKnight, Steele, Eversmann, Hoot and SANDERSON.

dialogues.speaker: CRIBBS
dialogues.text: We're running out of room already.

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
dialogues.text: We're just gonna have to cram 'em in to every possible space.

dialogues.speaker: CRIBBS
dialogues.text: Okay. Tenth Mountain will provide security for armor, walks us out of the hot zone --

dialogues.speaker: STEELE
dialogues.text: (disdain on his face) Tenth Mountain? No, Sir, with respect, my Rangers can provide rear security. We'll walk you out of the hot zone, and then we'll jump on the last few vehicles. Cribbs looks at the battle weary faces before him.

dialogues.speaker: CRIBBS
dialogues.text: Okay, let's get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: STEELE
dialogues.text: Let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the coffin-like APC, Grimes pounds on the driver's partition as bullets PING off the metal hull.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMES
dialogues.text: Come on! These things are fucking bullet magnets! Come on, let's go!

dialogues.speaker: PAKISTANI DRIVER
dialogues.text: We go when I'm ordered to, soldier.  268 269 270 120.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start on Wolcott.

dialogues.speaker: RANGER
dialogues.text: Easy, go easy. Easy. Go easy. A Ranger shines a light on Wolcott's buried legs. It's hopeless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares at the screen. Garrison can see Somalis again massing around three streets, choking off the convoy's ex

dialogues.speaker: GARRISON
dialogues.text: Colonel, what is going on down there? INTERCUT to McKnight on radio --

dialogues.speaker: MCKNIGHT
